name: Sharon Johnson
text: At location 851 Ann St, Montgomery AL. I and another gentleman waited for 15 minutes for someone to come to the counter. No signage of “by back in ?? min”. I could have walked in there and made my own sandwich and walked out and no one would be the wiser. The Walmart manager paged the person with no response. We both left. As I was walking outside I noticed the manager talking to a young lady with red and black hair and she was smoking and rummaging through a paper bag- perhaps her food.  I understand people need to take breaks but they should let the customer know this and when they will return.

name: kennedie
text: There was seriously 2 people in front of me and I still had to wait like 30 minutes for my food. Seriously Subway???!!! The food was good though.

name: Mrs. Sterling
text: 4th of July 2018 we visited this location for a quick bite as we didn't have time for a sit down meal anywhere and we were in no mood for Wal-Mart's deli food.  The 2 women working, (one older, on younger) were perhaps the most impatient Subway employees I have EVER come across.  The older woman, is blunt, and because of her strong accent I am sure she almost meant no harm but she was very, very, very, impatient.  As a matter of fact, as we were utilizing self-checkout at Wal-Mart I noticed her sit down, take a deep breath and I knew instantly we were in for a treat because she'd have to get up to service seconds after sitting down.  We took a chance anyway and to our surprise, she was the more pleasant employee of the two.  The younger lady/girl (maybe early to mid-twenties) was rude, she rushed our order, got the order wrong several times, became frustrated with us and said, "ok, what you want,  I am confused so please what do you want."  If we weren't dealing with a "time crunch" and needed to eat as our day continued, they would have made 2 sandwiches that they could have eaten themselves or tossed in the trash.    With the utmost surety, I can say that I will NOT EVER purchase anything from this Subway nor will I refer anyone to this Subway.  I was initial shocked to still see a Subway in a Wal-Mart but with this Customer Service, I don't know how much longer they'll last.

name: Jerry Taylor
text: Great food and service

name: Nathan Olm
text: Slowest subway on the planet. We'll go back to the moon before this place makes you a sandwich.

name: Jasmine Abner
text: Horrible service, ordered from the $6 menu didn’t get anything extra and was charged $7.59 after explaining my order employees became rude, arguing with each other speaking whatever language before simply giving me a dollar back

name: Creshenda Edwards
text: This subway suck!!!! They don't listen to you as a customer.

text: This subway suck!!!! They don't listen to you as a customer.

name: Hugo Contreras
text: The food is amazing every time!  Want a delicious sub? This is the place..forget the other guys, Can't beat this place!

name: Speakman28
text: These guys have the best sandwiches around hands down. I have eaten every kind of sub they make and none have disappointed. The pickle spear with each sandwich is a home run. The online ordering is easy and they have it waiting on you to grab and go. A+++

name: John D.
text: Long wait for a sandwich.  Waited 20 minutes.  Sandwich tasted great. Unfortunately, they forgot my pickle.  Hopefully they will get better!

name: Shannon Bright
text: I visited at 1:30 pm on Friday. They were somewhat busy. Seemed to be fully staffed. It's a new store so I expected it to be a little cleaner but maybe they just hadn't had time to clean up after the lunch crowd.

name: amy sullins
text: This was our first visit ever to a FHS. Cashier was a little unfriendly and not very helpful in explaining the menu. All other employees were nice though. Couldn't believe subs were on $4.79 until we got them and they are tiny ;) no where near enough for a teenage boy. So next trip we're getting larger sizes. They were really good though! The family has already asked to go back.

name: Austin kennedy
text: We actually had it catered in our office a few weeks back and was surprised at the presentation. Picked it up for lunch today and same great food. Definitely will recommend. I maybe had to wait 5 minutes.

name: mason Rulez
text: I just want to appreciate how hard the workers are working to complete each order. Yes of course theres a wait but if you dont want to wait for your food or if you are too impatient then go somewhere else. They are trying to do their best. They just opened and have been packed since. So try a little patience when ordering.

name: Roderick Jackson
text: Customer services was awful, a young boy let me sit and wait on my food while it was already  finished sitting on the counter in front of him. Previously before sitting down I asked him about my order and he told me he was making it then.  He knew my name but didn't call it nor try "again" once he claimed he had already called it. I know he didn't because I was 2ft in front of him. My family and I spend at least $50 each time we go to any firehouse.  I never been treated like this at any other firehouse but this one in Albertville.

name: Matthew Shipp
text: Great customer service and quality product. They're doing a pretty good job keeping wait times as low as possible despite the insane crowds.

name: mason Rulez
text: I just want to appreciate how hard the workers are working to complete each order. Yes of course theres a wait but if you dont want to wait for your food or if you are too impatient then go somewhere else. They are trying to do their best. They just opened and have been packed since. So try a little patience when ordering.

name: Lee Ann Michelle
text: The food is great and so is the service. No complaints at all.

name: Ryan B
text: Can’t speak for the restaurant it’s self but the website is a joke can’t get an account setup your loss subways gain

name: Ely Avila
text: The people who rated this place lower than a 5 star probably aren't happy with their lives, best sandwiches in town

name: Crissy Harris-Faulkner
text: My favorite sub shop love the food and that they support community fire stations

name: Theresa Peppers
text: Great subs little  pricey but worth the money

name: M. Kirkland
text: Great place to eat. Fast service.

name: Jim Bancroft
text: Love firehouse subs. Subs are tasty and wait staff are friendly.

name: Mike Root
text: Clean fast and friendly so glad Albertville finally got a decent sub place.

name: Melanie Riley
text: I love this place! I love the sandwiches! Cashiers on the other hand... Unfriendly and unhappy looking.

text: Very well pleased! I believe Albertville, Al is better than Gadsden, Al

name: Amanda Gregory
text: Great service and delicious subs. So glad they are here locally. Plus my dad is a retired firemen.

name: Jacinto Perez
text: Was there the last time and got the brisket barbecue sub and it was awesome but this time not much barbecue and little bit of meat more bread  not awesome 😞 very dissatisfied

name: Scott Barkley
text: This franchise is the best run anywhere.

name: ann noojin
text: Food is great  long wait time. But worth it

name: Michael Goodson
text: Sub's are great, service was fast.

name: Brandon Richardson
text: Awesome people and excellent food

name: Frances Hatmaker
text: Best subs ever

name: Kenneth Owens
text: Always pleased...

name: Arnold Collett
text: Very good subs!

name: Mark Weaver
text: The food was awesome

name: Of The Dawn
text: Like everything else in Albertville and boaz. Not worth the wait.

name: Kirkland Wilbanks
text: Best subs 😎😎😎

name: Jimmy Jones
text: Great

name: J.D. Purman
text: Loved it!

name: Dianne Common
text: Delicious

name: John Hallam
text: Thank goodness a store is close enough to us now.

name: Barry Johnson
text: Great food, but they need more help

name: Robert NOD
text: This franchise has ruined the menu. None of the current special sandwiches are here, no oven roasted chicken either. They only keep one employee on site, never seen a manger unless the manager is the only employee. Go a mile either direction on 280 and visit the other subways and save yourself the trouble. They have the full menu.

name: C Cubed
text:
Didn’t have my online order ready when I got there

2nd time this location has let me down.

name: Anaya Patel
text: Food and service is very good. Nice and clean store , staff is great too. Had a steak and cheese sandwich , which is strongly recommended.

name: Chaitali Patel
text:
UNDER NEW MANAGEMENT SINCE 2/2019

Well maintained, friendly staff and  they make great subs. They actually listen to what the customer wants. Definitely coming back to enjoy a good sub, cookies and soup.

name: Javier Pineda
text: Clean and great service

name: Chase Greene
text: Always a pleasure getting food here. Service and food have always been top notch in my experience. The manager and staff have always been great to me!

name: Lashon Williams
text: The customer service here at this location is amazing I’ve never experienced such a great customer service in a while most times when you go to fast food chains they employees act like they don’t want to be there but this particular young lady Mona was amazing .  Greeted us as soon as we hit the door Made sure we had everything we needed .  I will definitely be back because this place strives to give a great experience every time

name: josie callins
text: I like the indian girl she is very nice and she choose everything in my food it was very very delicious how she does.

name: Brandon Mitts
text:
So when you order the 2.99 spicy italian hows does that equal 4.87 B.M.T. beware they will steal you money and act like they dont know, this place is crooked and doesnt even know their own job or menu I WILL NEVER RETURN OR RECOMMEND TO ANYONE.... THIEVES
When you walk in have your wallet and jewlery ready with hands up

name: Sears Steele
text: Mona and her staff do a great job

name: Aaron Conley
text: One damn employee and couldn't get off his cell phone. You have one job to do and it isn't being on your cell

name: Nevy Rupani
text: Worst service ever.It says they close at 10 we reached at 9.35 and they said we r close.So unethical and unprofessional.I also heard a lot of bad reviews abt them.Thats the reason for people nt wanting to opt for subway in walmart.Wont be back.Be aware of this kind of service!!!!

name: Mari _D
text: The Subway employee would not get off her Cell phone to make any subs . I tried twice wile I was at Walmart.

name: Jack
text: So incredibly rude ! No one in the line,  two working with backs toward us, they saw us standing there and didn't even acknowledge us. We bought our meal at another location.

name: Kim Rollins
text: Got a meatball sub and it was delicious :)

name: Latoya Macon
text: The absolute worst experience ever.. I stood in line 25 minutes to not be served!!! Place was filthy!

name: Nelly Leguisamo
text: It was only 1 person for a lot of costumers

name: James Gross
text: The manager there is a total asshat

name: Kathryn
text: Slow service! Took forever.

name: gustavo esaa
text:
(Translated by Google) Delicious

(Original)
Delicioso

name: Gavin Thor
text:
Just couldn't do another chain restaurant on our trip. This place does have local charm and pleasant staff. We arrived about 930, so the grill might have been off...if true,then that's why breakfast took a really long time to arrive. I was assuming the food should have been extra hot then right? No... but done correctly and very tasty. Styrofoam plates and plastic utensils take away from what could be a cute place. Overall good fare, but needs fine tuning.

Show less

name: Fredrick Caves
text: Great service and great cooks

name: Leigh Turberville McElroy
text: Awesome breakfast and superb service!! Will visit again soon!

name: Romeo Vellutini
text: This is a nice little out of the way place. Definitely a local hangout, but they are nice.

name: Angela Walker
text: Always delicious.

name: Larry Allday
text:
They cook one fine breakfast omelet.
Along with the other items.

name: Justin Parker
text: This place is awesome for breakfast and lunch. I highly recommend it to anyone. The breakfast wrap is phenomenal! Brownies, cookies, cakes and pies are also spectacular! Prices are very reasonable.

name: Amanda Younge
text: They always have great food and awesome service

name: Anthony Quinn
text: Loaded hashbrowns for breakfast are incredible! Good service and prices. FRESH taste and ingredients.

name: Tolethia Kidd
text: I really enjoy their loaded baked potato

name: Nathanael Evans
text: Excellent food, and better service

name: Matthew Rhodes
text: Great food. Get the omelet for breakfast

name: Chris Raley
text: As always Perfect !!!

name: Deonna Prince
text: Great food!

name: Jason Johnson
text:
We found this little gem about 2 years ago and fell in love with it.

We have only been one time but it has been memorable.

Delicious, nutritious, and healthy sandwiches with a mix of new and inspiring.

Their Sweet Potato Fries are just the best and worth the trip every-time.

name: Micheal Porter
text: Great food. Great staff. We got the Fish, the Bacon LT, and the Smoked Turkey sandwiches. All were VERY good. Sides we had were sweet potato waffle fries and pasta salad. I would highly recommend both. All food came out fast and was very fresh.

name: Robert Sung
text:
This place is amazing.  So amazing I briefly entertained the thought of quitting my job (which I love) and opening a chain of these restaurants.

They prepare the ingredients correctly and compose it so that there is a contrast of flavors and textures.

Small menu, but everything is done well, which I like.  Every sandwich place should be like this.

This place is a must try next time you are in Huntsville!

name: Rachel Fortson
text: Everything on the menu is good. I cant say anything bad about the place. I love the breakfast served thru lunchtime. Buttermilk pancakes with citrus syrup is so yummy and made with fresh ingredients. Who knew candied oranges inside syrup tasted so good! You can tell the difference with the ingredients they use. I wish there were more restaurants like this. If you have been to Hillbilly Tea in Louisville, it is very similar. Eclectic. It's always busy and has limited seating, so you must be patient!! I order to-go and my food is always ready when I get there.

name: Chandler Reynolds
text: Great food at a reasonable price. The SOS (toast, chopped steak, gravy, and eggs) is my current favorite, but I've tried many of the other dishes. They were all excellent. It can get crowded during common meal times, but mornings typically aren't bad.

name: Drew Scott
text: This is my new favorite sandwich place. The sandwiches taste super fresh and all the ingredients taste quality. The pasta salad is excellent as well. Probably the best turkey sandwich I've ever had.

name: Anna Mitchell
text: Best sandwich shop in town!  I love the turkey sandwich and the shrimp and grits benedict the best, but everything else is wonderful.  The staff is amazing.  Can't say anything bad about this place!

name: Ester
text: Great customer service! Hidden treasure downtown. Looked for surrounding places to get food since I had a two hour wait at the DMV. Only three minutes away, literally. And now they're working with grub South.... It doesn't get better!

name: Shauna Olson
text: Food was good, but there was so much smoke in the air and my eyes are really sensitive I had to leave. I don't know if that's a normal occurrence, or if something caught fire or what

name: Gena Rawdon
text: Amazing food, awesome people who are dedicated to their craft. I love this place.

name: Andrew Walker
text: I really enjoy the laid back atmosphere along with some runny eggs! Love the various options, one of my favorite brunch options.

name: Cody Hornbuckle
text: Found a hair in my sandwich. Pasta salad was  tasteless and it was way too expensive for what it was. Plus from the moment I walked in the door the front counter girl with the thick hipster glasses gave me tons of attitude. Never going again.

name: Mallory Dotson
text: Delicious! Turkey sandwich is one of the best I've ever had! Can't wait to try breakfast foods!

name: Evan Suggs
text: Breakfast was great! Both syrup options were delicious - I wish they sold them by the bottle.

name: Justin Bzdell
text: I like the atmosphere, location, and view of Downtown Huntsville & Veterans Memorial big U.S. Flag. But the the prices are too high. Food is okay, and it took 30 minutes for food to be cooked.

name: Stan Reese
text: My son and I had excellent burgers and outstanding service. We will be back!

name: Amy Hasenyager
text: Super disappointed. We wanted Reubens. From all accounts online, they had a reuben on the menu. We get there and no reuben sandwich. In fact there were  very few sandwiches, considering it's a sandwich 'farm'. And we got a lot of "we are out of that" when we did try to order. Fish on the fish sandwich was rubbery. The chicken sandwich was unexpectedly buffalo. And the bun on the hamburger was chewy (maybe that's just a thing.)

name: Miranda Fike
text: Name's changed to Lumberyard Kitchen, but the food is the same. Delightful flavor combinations, decor with personality, and happy staff make this an easy favorite of mine.

name: J Mac
text: If you live in the Huntsville area and you aren't eating here, you are doing it wrong.

name: Jacob van Akin
text: It's good.

name: Matt Varian
text: Very tasty sandwiches

name: Scott Harden
text: Great sandwiches!

name: Mike Masinelli
text: Excellent!

name: Uzi Bahar
text: Great sandwiches!!!

name: James Brooks
text: Very good sandwiches. Always hot and fresh. Friendly staff and a convenient location.

name: Will Steineker
text: I’ve eaten at this particular Which Wich several times and never had anything other than a really terrific experience. The selection and quality are fantastic, and the location is super convenient to just about everything in Midtown/Southside. Things can get really busy during lunch hour, but the staff always seem to go out of their way to fill the mountain of orders as quickly as possible. This place is definitely worth your time and money, just like the vast majority of the reviews here will tell you. Give them a shot ASAP, folks. You won’t be let down!

name: Angela Hardiman
text: I’d never eaten at a Which ‘Wich before so I was delighted to try something different in Birmingham. I had a great experience. The employees were attentive and friendly. My order was made exactly as I had ordered and was delicious! I’ll definitely make this restaurant my go-to place when I’m in the area!

name: Elizabeth Ragona
text: This is a fairly new place. The young man was very helpful and did a good job explaining their ordering process. He recommended the French dip, which I got. The sandwich was good but the bread wasn't strong enough to handle to gravy and it got soggy quickly.

name: Steve Severance
text:
The food was amazing, as I expected, having been to other Which witch's. But parking was nearly impossible to find. I ended up parking in a parking deck that was restricted, I got my food and left as quickly as possible so I wouldn't get a ticket or towed. That knocked 2 stars off.

If you're already in the area, it's probably your absolute best and healthiest option, but if you're driving there, probably not worth the hastle.

name: Kerry Stober
text: Sandwiches here are made according to what you select on the bag so it would be pretty difficult to mess that part up, as they look at it while they are making them. Service here was slower than when I go into other Which Wich locations, even though I was the only person in line. The girl at the register was more interested in chatting with a friend and had her back to me. The guys making the sandwiches told her repeatedly to turn around and she ignored them. Overall they seemed nice and my sandwich was fine, but they weren't really interested in great customer service.

name: kelley cornelius
text: I have been twice. Turkey sub the first time it was good. Bread was great and fast. The next time I got the Reuben. It was great. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Clean and delicious.

name: Jared Spates
text: Very fast and always fresh! This is a new regular place for my lunch break. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The only downside is parking is tough to find in the lunch hours.

name: Raj Patel
text: I have had sandwiches from other places, but the one I ate at which Wich was the best of all. It’s a perfect combination of Subway and Pita Pit, and the best part is it’s not even expensive as you would think they would be.

name: Foxtail TV
text: The sandwiches are good, I love how they let people decided what kind of sandwich they want I can't wait to eat their again. Yummy!!!!

name: DUSTIN VERNON
text: I feel they have a more varied menu which is great and there staff is nice. Good place for those that want a sandwich, but not just a sandwich.

name: Elizabeth M. Cornelius
text: The sandwich selection is great and it is in a perfect location downtown. Great option if you are in the area looking for food.

name: Stephen Foster
text: So glad we have one now in The Waites building in 5pts South. The staff is very friendly and already well trained for being such a new store. Can't wait to come back again.

name: Ron McCurdy
text: I've always enjoyed the sandwiches and customer service at Whichwich. For some reason his is the only location left in Birmingham.

name: Jeff Harvey
text: Great staff and always clean. The food is good.

name: Beenie Weenie
text: I ordered a Banh Mi, and when the guy gave it to me he said "Sorry, these aren't too popular so we dont keep cilantro and carrots in stock.". I tried to eat the sandwich anyways, and the egg on the sandwich was far undercooked (whites were still gelly and runny). I could tell the other ingredients were great, and I bet any other sandwich would have been great. Just dont get a Banh Mi.

name: Erin Howell
text: Great sandwich with lots of options! Good for a quick lunch or dinner.

name: Chris
text: Made a call in order for hospital staff and was told would be ready in 20 mins. However, when I arrived to pick up the order, after 20 mins had passed, the staff pulled up the order and nothing had been made. The staff members were very rude and did not have any of the specifics on any of the orders. All of the 5 orders were made wrong and the staff did not care. I will not return because of the lack of customer service.

name: Chris Williams
text: Reuben was absolutely terrible. Too many people were in line for me to wait around to talk to someone for the "guarantee" of satisfaction.

name: Christin W.
text: It's a great little sandwich with excellent customer service.

name: David Sutton
text: Love Which Wich so much. Great sandwiches!

name: summer bolinger
text: Best sandwich shop hands down

name: Son of Hecate
text: A very fun and interesting selection of sandwiches.

name: Brian Cupps
text: Great sandwich. Super fresh.

name: yolanda clark
text: Fingers crossed food was ready at pick up

name: Amanda Dungan

I don't know about the quality of the food or service there, but if you want to try to get a job at this particular franchise, well, screw you if you can't get you're butt there, I guess.

Then the server turned to her co-worker and shrugged her shoulders and huffed. I apologized for the inquiry and walked out. I am only here with a family member having tests run. I would hate to know someone going through a more serious situation might be met with the same greeting. Customer service is apparently a lost art these days.

text:
Love this place!! I use them for Catering and they have exceeded my expectation repeatedly. the Catering manager was very nice on the phone and was excited to walked me through the catering menu and helped me make my order very delicious. My clients LOVED it!

I also eat there all the time on the weekends and they have healthy options for me and unhealthy options for my husband!

name: Jake Ellis
text: No sense of urgency. I came at normal dinner time (6:30pm) and there was only one person making sandwiches. He was chilling and taking his time. Took 20 minutes to make a simple plain chicken and cheese sandwich. Will not be back.

name: Dia Malik
text: This is a good alternative to Subway as the meat is not processed. The process is super simple too. All you do is grab a bag to the corresponding meat and check mark whatever toppings, bread, and size you want. I love this versus having to say every topping at Subway. The also do thin bread and lettucewichs for people on a diet. My only complaint is the bread selection which consists of white and wheat. I would love for them to try something with a little for finesse.

name: Erin Price
text: So, the sandwiches are actually pretty good as far as fast food goes but I've had to go head to head with the employees too many times at this location. My suggestion: order online!!! When I buy online the pricing and order are always correct. Also ... Skip the bowl. I was really excited to try this option but it's not enough food. The don't put enough lettuce/spinach. The topping ratio seems fine but the filling not so much... Too much money for a 10 bite salad.

name: chelsea h
text: Unfortunately you cannot give 0 stars for service. I tried placing an online order at 10 am this morning (trying to give them ample time), there was a glitch and my credit card kept getting declined. I called the store and asked to fax the order and pay when I get there, the girl said of course except she didn't even know the correct fax number. I'm ordering sandwiches for a lunch at my office, so there is a time constraint so I figured I can just print off my orders and hand them the list however when I got there the lady made me fill out their stupid bags for all of my orders, so I'm not sure the difference if I just faxed them my order for pickup, thus me not filling out all of the bags. After having to do all of this, I was highly annoyed. The manager told me an order like this (8 sandwiches) would typically take two hours, so if you're in a rush and there are 7 people ahead of you beware because apparently it will take two hours to make all 8 of those sandwiches. The manager/owner kept making up excuse after excuse followed by a lousy apology. When I left with all of my sandwiches, I told her I would make sure to give them a review, she said "whatever" followed by yet another lousy apology. I worked in the service industry for years and would never have been rude to a customer regardless of how they act, so her attitude was completely unacceptable.

text:
So, I’m going to go ahead and retract my original statement. This which wich, while I’ve had a few problems, still lives up to which wich’s expectations. I’ve met with the owner twice now and he is wonderful. He tries to right every wrong and I applaud him for that.

Overall in terms of “general” info. The store is always very clean. Food is prepared well. It’s fast service. I can’t complain anymore.

Reason why I left a review before was I constantly came at the same time as one employee and they messed up my order. If I sort of flex my schedule, things turn out perfect. Thank you, owner. Thank you, Which Wich. Keep up the good work.

text: They don't have any breakfast sandwiches anymore. Their bacon, egg, and cheese was the sole reason I loved this restaurant so much. Not impressed with the imitation crab and tuna salad they replaced it with, either.

name: Lee Fuqua
text:
Awful...

The experience was awful. I was at the Huntsville Al in the Jones Valley location. I date a beautiful young black woman. We were there and one of our sandwich's did not come out right. Let me say we go to the Tuscaloosa Al location all the time and have never had an issue and love their staff. So we had a sandwhich we had gotten numerous times (she always gets the same thing) get messed up. My girlfriend took the sand which up to the General Manager. She stated it was missing a few things and the manager the opens the sandwich up and starts pointing out "there some here" "ohh its here".  She stated that she usually gets that at another location and it's different. He then takes her bag yells at a girl in the back and says, "will you remake this" turns his back and walks off without another word. The girl then goes to the back and they talk for a minute. Then her and another girl come out and remake it making remarks the whole time "there's clearly mushrooms here" "well load it this time so their happy"... All of this we can hear. I am trying to be courteous and not eat my sandwich so I can enjoy it with my girlfriend. She however is hearing all the remarks they are making about it and even is starting to feel racially profiled. We are a mixed couple. We get there are people out there not ready for that. Your in a service industry. We pay for what we want to eat how we want it. To top it all, the girl making it once she is done throws it.... THROWS IT on the counter then walks off to the back and leaves it there. Doesn't say the name or bring it to us. Just left the sandwhich there and walked to the back. We didn't see any of them again till another customer came in. We got no apology, no refund, or no little gift card(Tuscaloosa  gave us a tone just for waiting). Not only did we leave feeling disrespected but racially profiled as well...

The Tuscaloosa Which Which is the best I have been to and I will continue going there. Never as long as I live in Huntsville will I return to that store. What's sad is I am in marketing and we take a lot of catering from them. That will also be stopping...

text: Oh meh gerhd! Excellent sandwich, clean shop, & outstanding customer service! We will be back!

Horrible customer service.

- Sign, a customer that manages Customer Service

If you look at the timing of these reviews you will see that all the bad ones talking about bugs and other things are within a few minutes or hours of each other. This is because an employee who threw a temper tantrum and walked out decided to seek revenge on our business by having all of her little minions post bad reviews. Our health score speaks for itself. None of these people posting in the last day or so have ever even BEEN to our restaurant. Please ignore the childish behavior of these people.

text:
We stopped here on our way home. I’ve never tried it until then but I can say I never will again! Atleast not this location!!
First and for most the employees were arguing in front of customers when I first walked in.
Second, my food tastes HORRIBLE! Like the refrigeration wasn’t running very well on where they keep the meats. Third, whip I was eating the sandwich I send a FREAKING ROACH CRAWLING ON THE WALL.
I tried to get the manager but she was “busy”, all the employee would tell me is her name was ranni ? I tried to call her after we left to inform her of our stop and hopefully get these situations explained and fixed! Never got a call back.

name: Duncan Mills
text:
Honestly it just all around sucked.

The line/checkout was confusing, I did not know where to pay or wait for my food. My sub wasn’t made right in front of me like literally every other sub sandwich place. They got it served through the window then I got asked “what you want?” And they peel open your sandwich to add ingredients.

The food, albeit edible for a hungry shift worker, was pretty sad. All I wanted was a normal BLT sub sandwich with mayo, and some chips. Instead, I got served this weird but sad triple-decker pressed Texas toast BLT. I didn’t mind the non traditional approach, but the execution was bad. The Texas toast was smashed so thin I had this dense layer of mayonaise soaked bread to peel off my teeth. The bacon was cooked well but the lack of lettuce, tomato, and a normal sub bun kinda ruined it.

At least it was cheap, around $7.50, so at least it wasn’t an expensive mistake.

name: Jay Myers
text: Had lunch there last week. Very helpful staff, and food was GREAT! Prices were less that I expected too.

name: Dawn Marsh
text: If I could give less than one star I would. There's roaches crawling around and gnats swarming the food. 1the food is awful. Don't bother wasting your time.

text: Owners are terrible after complaining about the wrong order the owner come and harassed my wife and I at our table!

name: Chase R
text: Dont bother wasting your time or money. Got the philly cheese steak that was 15 dollars with a fry and drink which was pathetic for that type of money. Low quality ingredients, hardly any meat on it and a bland taste and as someone else said, luke warm soggy fries that had been sitting out for who knows how long. You would think for being a "Sub" shop a philly cheese steak would be a strong point but I was sadly mistaken. If you want a better meal for a better price I'd advise you taking your money anywhere else but here.

Not until 9:36 did the blonde manager come out and tell me "they're open, just not serving". Online hours say they're open at 9am. I told her I only need a sweet tea, and she told me "we're not serving". So thank you, for wasting almost 10 minutes of my break just to then not allow me to purchase a simple sweet tea. I'll take my business to chick fil a.

text: Picked up  dinner to go. We had the Beef and Cheese, chicken salad, grilled chicken and Greek style shrimp buns. Also a side of the Orange Beach Caviar. Loved the food. This is a new must have when we come to the beach.

name: Ben Podbielski
text: Everything about Buns in the Sun was amazing! We had the pork belly, chicken bacon ranch, chicken salad, and steak and cheese, at the recommendation of the chef, and we were not disappointed! The atmosphere was a welcome relief from the typical restaurants in the area and even though we are only down here for a couple days we will be back!

name: Chad Chavez
text: My only regret is that we came here on the way out of town and not on the way in. Great food, great service. Will definitely be my spot next time I come through.

name: Cox Creations
text: This place is EXCELLENT! The food, the employees, and the restaurant. The games kept my kids occupied while we waited! The wait was not bad at all! Especially to be cooked fresh. I have a picky eater, so a bacon sandwich worked great for us!! VERY, very, clean building! Also the photo machine was a great laugh for us!!! Will defiantly return!! The 4.8 *’s is what brought us!!!

name: sarah smith
text: This place is a gem! Food is absolutely amazing. Mouth is watering just thinking about it. I was only visiting albama when I found this place, but I'd make a special trip here again just to have their food. The establishment itself is adorable. Cozy beach setting and friendly workers. The owner is the cook and hes so passionate about his food and you can tell in the taste. The buns are what makes this place stand out the most. They are steamed to moist perfection. You have to try this place. HAVE TO! You will not be disappointed.

name: Mrs. James Henderson
text:
My son has always wanted me to try steamed buns and he found this place for me to try. All I can say is amazing delicious wow. Our favorite was the steamed pork belly button. No it doesn’t taste like bacon it is soft and delicious. Porky but good.

It is so delicious we were eating in that I decided to order I took go order of the spicy shrimp. Smells so good was not able to even wait till we got home ate it on the way home. I would think everything there is amazing.

Yummy yummy soft yeast rolls With many choices of great feelings.

name: William Holden
text: Those buns are amazing. Owner is friendly and the place has a nice laid back vibe. Kind of tucked away so you have to look for it. Sandwiches are on the small side but its quality over quantity here. Just order the beach combo and get 2. Korean bbq is very tasty.

name: Amanda Elder
text: Amazing food! Excellent service! Family run business well worth supporting! And they were the only place open after 3pm when Gordon hit!!

name: William Byrd
text: This place is amazing! They have THE best steamed buns you will find in ALL of Orange Beach or Gulf Shores. The have some awesome flavors put together but my favorite is the pork belly. It is very well priced, so it's definitely worth a visit or two a week.

name: Gretchen Porter
text: We ordered 5 different sandwiches and they were all SO yummy (OMG...the homemade steamed buns😋) and owners were so friendly and welcoming! They really do have THE best white chocolate bread pudding we've ever had! We will definitely make this a regular stop on our frequent trips to Orange Beach👍

name: Amy Reeves
text: Loved the food. Small menu. We tried the BBQ sandwich and the chicken sandwich. They were both great, the buns were delicious. As was the mango lemonade! Definitely recommend for a quick lunch while visiting. They even have card games on all of the tables to occupy the kids. Very cute restaurant!

name: John Adams
text: Fantastic sandwiches. A great friendly take on steamed bao with options for everyone, including an excellent veggie burger. Clean and kid friendly with a lot of little diversions at each table. We'll be back!

name: Hannah DeShazo
text: This place is a must go! The owner/chef is amazing! Joon and his staff are so friendly and make you feel at home! Their homemade chicken salad and the orange beach caviar (black eyed pea salad) is my favorite! If you don't visit this place, you are missing out!

name: Hieu nguyen
text: Got a Togo the guy at the front was unprofessional, food wasn’t what I expected. Looks like they just threw it in the box without looking. Don’t waste you’re time food is alright at best for the price.

name: Cassidy DeShazo
text: Great food, great service. It's very clean and the staff makes you feel at home! I highly recommend eating here.

name: Jason pate
text: Friendly,  beach atmosphere and the food is outstanding. Everything is made fresh in house and you can really taste the difference. Give it a try. Will not be disappointed.

name: J C
text: I have the Korean BBQ bun. It had very good flavor and I would have liked to have had more of it on my bun. Also would like an option of a baked bun.

text:
I had a coupon for “free, any beverage”.  I ordered a cup of mocha latte with the coupon but a lady there said that the coupon was only for soft drinks and coffee not a special one. I could tell that she did not welcome a customer with a coupon.  Her altitude and face expression seemed  to  look down on me.   If the employees do not appreciate having customers with coupons, the company should not provide any coupons in public.
I do not recommend going there with any discount deals.

text: Stopped at Corner Quick stop to get two cups of ice for drinks I already had. Went in and got two cups from the store side and noticed the I've had black chunks in it. I'm disgust I walked to the counter and explained to the cashier with black rotted teeth that that was inappropriate and was going to pour it out. I looked over at subway and seen they had their own drink dispenser marked subway customers only, I was at the point where I would pay their price for Ice just so I would not have to drink black mold. I pushed my cup against it to fill with ice and wow disgusting the same thing, black chunks in the Ice. I threw my cups away and decided to leave. Would give negative stars if I could. Very nasty place. Will never be back. If the Ice looks that way I could only imagine how the food is stored at this location. I hope someone In upper management steps in before the health department shuts the doors!

name: Shawn Bowman (Shasas)
text: Stopped by to ge a sandwich on my lunch break and was met by an older lady who was busy helping another customer, ok fine. She looks over and says " push that button as soon as your ready" to which I replied "sure thank you". Well I was having a difficult time deciding on my sandwich as I eat here alot and have had almost every combination you could think of. Well there was no one behind me and in fact hardly anyone in the store but while I was debating with myself the lady reaches up and pushes the button herself and another older lady comes from the back I immediately inform her I was not ready and did not push the button and the first lady says " well you was just standing there". I declined to patronize this establishment after this as I do not like to be rushed by the employees of someplace that's supposed to be serving ME not the other way around. Now things like this have happened here before these ladies are always working together and one is nice and the other is not. The one that is not often times has smart things to say or is very rude and short with customers and today I just wasnt having it. I understand your elderly but if you cant handle customer service you should perhaps find another job. It's because of this unprofessional attitude that this lady has on everyone of my visits that I will NOT be returning as a customer , possibly all subways but most definitely this one.

name: Boyanna Weaver
text: Best sub ever..

name: Caleb Hawn
text: I absolutely LOVE Subway. This specific Subway location is definately no exception. It's located inside of the Wavaho gas station, so you can buy more then what they sell at Subway, so you can get a candy bar or anything else to go with your meal instead of only chips. Don't get me wrong, though; I do enjoy their chips. I also love the avacado/guacamole season, which happens every summer. I LOVE their avacado and guacamole sandwhich toppings. You can choose any toppings you want, or just order something on the menu. I almost never order from the menu. I just choose exactly what I want my sub to be, which is what Subway's all about. I love this location because it's like right near my house, so it is really convenient for mybfamily and I to order take out. If you want to eat IN the place, they do have a single two-peeson table you can eat at. If you are passing by this nice building, you can stop by and get some Subway, as well as anything else they sell at a gas station/car oil place. Thank you for reading my review of this unique Subway location, and I hope that I could help you choose weather or not to visit it. Thanks!

Asked her to manually enter the price and was told that couldn't be done.  Asked for her to ring up a similarly priced item instead.  Was told very rudely "No".

Gave her a choice to honor what she admitted was a valid and local coupon or throw the entire order in the garbage.  She still refused...so I walked out.

name: John Doe
text: If you are using coupons at this location don’t even bother. We had a 100% valid coupon for Buy 1 Get 1 Free Footlong and were told no Subway locations are accepting the coupons that they are advertising. We were told every Subway in the area will also not accept the coupon because it’s too good of a deal. It’s almost as if Subway is advertising the coupon and telling their employees not to honor the coupon after the sandwiches are made so the customer winds up paying full price because they are already there. We said absolutely not and they threw away both sandwiches in front of us. Instead of making money off the Buy 1 Get 1 coupon, they just threw away 2 perfectly good sandwiches and made no money. Absolutely ridiculous waste of food and time.

Walked in and smiled at her..nothing. She was short with everything she said like I was completely inconveniencing her until someone she knew walked in and was oh so friendly to them. name: Jessica Brown
text: Wow the two girls at the meat, bread and cheese end were so rude. First of all they didn’t look up or speak to me until they were good and ready. Once the one who took my order did, she acted like it was not only a bother and irritation, but if we didn’t have a bar in between us, that she would actually pounce on me. They were preparing a platter upon arrival and I guess they were so out of sorts about it they thought we will take it out on our customers & only kind employee that was there. The poor girl at other end that put toppings on and checked you out was extremely nice and did her job well. The other two scolded her and treated her like she was incompetent. I’m surprised she wasn’t in tears clearly they were frustrated with her as well, however I’d much rather have someone like her mess my order up than either of these girls touch my food again. The girl was counting my change out slowly so I left the tip on counter and walked over to drink station. One of the other girls came down and jumped on the girl asking in a bullying tone “what’s this?” I spoke up & answered and told the sweet girl to keep her head up and a smile on her face. Other two girls snickered, said something and laughed not in a happy laugh but condescending. I wish the poor sweet girl didn’t have to split the tip with the two mean girls. Whoever owns this location should be ashamed of themselves if they keep these other two girls on staff. I’m sure they will team up in defense together but I urge the owner to think hard before believing a word out their mouths.

name: Marian Carter

Apartenly, we asked for the wrong type...so instead of explaining she kept asking if we wanted flat bread and rolling her eyes. We were getting 6 subs and cookies...so we walked out and went to Subway on Perdido Blvd. instead. They were super nice and very helpful. We are local and will never go back there again!

text: I drive all the way up here to this subway at 8o’clock at night just to get there and be told that they’re closed. And they didn’t just tell me they were closed they were waving me away telling me to shoo. I saw the time on the door said they didn’t close until nine so I asked why they were closed and he said because we want to. Won’t ever be back here again.

name: Amanda Lord
text: First of all, both employees  Were supposed to be wearing masks. They were, but they were both wearing them below their noses. Good job guys. Not! Both employees were rude, one kept running the cash register with the same gloves she would handle food with. I asked for a chopped salad- my meat was NOT chopped up. She was going to give me cold bacon I had to ask for it to be heated up. I asked about dressing and the one employee rudely ignored me and  gave me my total for my salad. I paid and she was putting gloves on again getting ready to serve the next customer and I again asked about salad dressing. She sighed and said ‘well there should be some in there (there wasn’t) but what kind do you want?’ I told her and she threw the packet in there and slung my bag at me. Get back to eat my salad at work and the meat isn’t even chopped up. Not only were their attitudes poor (no ‘hi how are you, what can i get for you today’ or ‘thanks have a good day’ just rudeness. The freezer door was also open the entire time I was there. Im sure there are more than several health code violations mixed in all that. I worked at subway in high school and I know the masks aren’t fun but I work in healthcare so I have to wear them all day every day too. And if I would have acted the way those two ladies did today I would’ve been fired. No matter what job you have do it to the best of your ability. Shame on whoever the manager is for letting this go on. I WILL NOT be back. And I will also tell everyone I know not to use this store either.

name: Robert Jackson
text: Staff was friendly sub was good what else do you really want. Sure beats a drive through!

name: James R
text: Well, I've tried to post a review 3 times now but it keeps getting taken down. I guess Subway doesn't want people to know about the lazy employees, (line of 5 people while one girl makes sandwiches and runs register. wow.) letting their kids, not only come to work with them (no big deal), but let them in the back while they go through touching EVERYTHING. Then, I swear, almost systematically touching, wiping hands on face and moutch and nose, and touching ALL the food in the back that was to be brought up front. What's really concerning is the fact that they keep taking this down, why don't you handle the situation at work instead of trying to cover it up? Disgusting.

Overpriced mediocre sandwiches.

Visit tonight reminded me why i quit going to Subway...small meat portions...my choice of cheddar yielded a small sprinkling of "shredded" cheese so they could apparently limit the portion of it too.  Same for lettuce, etc, etc. One whole and one half skimpy sandwich cost $14.  Won't be back.

name: Don Julio
text:
I ordered 2 combos, a number 1 and a number 3 and some soup. Soup was cold out of the pot, it is supposed to be kept at a proper temp (140 or above).
Secondly, when I went to pay the numbers didn't come out right when she told me the total. When I questioned the total I was told over and over. Its right..Its Right, You order soup. When I looked at the receipt I was right, each sandwich had an Extra 25 cents tacked on, no not alot, I know but, that is the same as stealing...check your receipt if you go there, I wont be back. If someone lies about one thing they will lie about another and can't be trusted.

name: ARKTOS AUROCH
text: Judgement Day: I am one of those demands my money's worth. At first I was pressured / obligated (small business and all) to eat there. After eating quite a "few" times now, I can honestly say the sandwiches are "GREAT", when you have a salad there you've had a salad (none of this: ok I've had it, I'm still hungry). The cakes are made on site (from scratch no less) some of the best I have ever had, and the slices are so big, when you finish your sandwich you will have some to eat later. The service that you receive there is one of genuine southern hospitality but rarely seen nowadays....So yes they have truly earned a five star rating

name: Kathleen Morgan (LeenaBeena)

text:
We are a party of 3 looking for a light soup and sandwich meal on the day before Thanksgiving. The soup was fresh and flavorful, exactly what we were looking for. The sandwiches used good quality meats. I had ordered a Rueben, and my only complaint was that it was on wheat bread and not a rye. Overall, a good quality lunch with very nice, friendly staff.

The surprise was the staff brought out a small chocolate cake for us to share that was to die for! I am generally not a cake fan, but this cake was super moist with perfect amount of chocolate. It's worth a 14 hour drive just for the chocolate cake.

I eventually left because of how slow they were to even acknowledge us. I don't know how this place stays open. I'm hoping a decent coffee shop will open at the downtown square because Huntsville can use one

resp.text:
Anna,

This is from Cathy. one of the owners of A Cup Of Everything.

Thank you so much for letting us know about this. I will be discussing this with our managers. We work hard to offer great customer service and apologize for for your experience..

Cathy

Mr. LukiPooki

I am one of the owners of A Cup of Everything. I am very sorry you hear that you have has such poor service at ACoE. Please know that we appreciate yours and all our customer's business. If you like I eill be happy to meet you at the shop and I will personally refund you your money.

Regards
Cathy Lamberth
Clamberth@acupofeverything.com

name: Katheryn Young
text:
A Cup of Everything Convenience Store is truly convenient--a menu loaded with coffees, teas, and sandwiches primarily; and a medium-sized cache of snack bars, bottled and canned drinks, chips, and even things like headache medicine, this little restaurant/shop is a wonderful addition to the Square in downtown HSV. In addition to having just about anything you might find yourself needing while out on a stroll around downtown, or serving jury duty, etc., the staff is incredibly friendly and will (in my experience) go out of their way to ensure your good day.
However, you will be paying convenience store prices for most of their selections: a cup of coffee will only leave you a little better off than a visit to Starbucks (without the carefully constructed flavor--ACoE's coffee has been particularly bitter in my experience, even with sugar and cream), and the food can get a little pricey as well. Packaged foods, on the other hand, seem to be a bit cheaper than, say, the store inside the courthouse but it's not really enough to keep me from driving the little extra distance to the Publix at Twickenham Square.
The cozy atmosphere and neat meeting space upstairs, though, may be enough to counter-balance the slightly higher prices and not-so-awesome coffee--and a warm Spring day sat outside with a cold cup of iced tea and a fresh-made sandwich can't quite be beat.
So all-in-all, if you don't mind spending a bit more and not getting Starbucks-quality coffee, you will get a cozy, unique atmosphere great for a refreshing time on your own or with friends.

name: Super Frivolous
text:
Was soooo good.  Had a rough Friday and came in and asked for a Chocopresso, one shot expresso, one shot chocolate wine, topped with whipped cream and chocolate sauce. Took the edge right off and had served by the sweetest batista.

Would def get again.

name: Zebbo Leppo
text:
On Sundays, their most expensive items are $5, but they are regularly $6.50, which is very comparable to Subway.  Their wraps are a little skinny, which is not a complaint from me,  but still 1' long, which is good for a solid meal.  Their ingredients were stunningly fresh, which I find hard to get from cheap fast food (especially lettuce and avocado), and my cold wrap order was served almost instantly.  The flavor combinations are actually pretty innovative given a total of only a few ingredients.

Now, their wraps are not bursting with grease and flavor.  They're meant to be on the healthier side (it's impossible for a wrap, chips, and water to go beyond 1,000 calories, and they post all their calorie information on the menu).  As such, they taste lighter, which isn't necessarily bad, but a tuna, mango chutney, avocado wrap for $5?  Good grief.  I was more than happy with it.  I got a chicken, walnut, avocado, tomato, alfalfa, yogurt and curry sauce wrap to-go.  Again, the ingredients all tasted perfectly fresh.  Same price.  Neither wrap surpassed 700 calories.

Simply perfect fast food for a guy on a diet.  I wish there were more places just like it.  I can't believe I found it by just wandering around.

Every time I have visited this establishment I can see the lack of effort and passion in about every aspect of the way he runs this business. Morality is low among his employees although I think they try harder then he does to connect with his customers. Food, price and location deserve 5 stars. Hospitality, morality, and customer service gets this establishment 1 star from me.

text:
I ordered from this location because online ordering for the Galleria-area location was down. I won't be repeating that mistake.  Not only are quoted prepare times much longer (30 mins vs 15), but my order wasn't even ready when I arrived after 30 minutes. The hot sandwiches had not even been put on the presser yet, so I had to wait yet another 10 minutes to those to cook.  Also I didn't get an extra sauce that I had ordered, and either the soups sizes are smaller here or I also got a cup when when I ordered a bowl. As a finishing touch the soup spoon was somehow stapled to the bag.

Next time if online ordering is still down for the other location I will bite the bullet and phone in my order. At least it will go to a competent store.

Really good sandwich, and super fast. Had the ham and cheese and it's delicious - I just wish I lived closer. Also, the half size was way bigger than I was expecting!
Ampersandwich' reminds me of Firehouse, but so many levels higher quality and way tastier.

This place is gonna blow up.

name: The Lounge Guys
text: Went to the Avondale location for the first time tonight. Ordered 2 full Club Sandwiches, one with no peppers, and one with no mayo, mustard, or peppers. The 2 guys behind the counter made them in the wrong size, so I had to wait while they made them again. They finally gave me my sandwiches (wrapped up and in a bag), so I took them home, only to discover that neither sandwich had any cheese on them, one had only ham and no other meats, and both had onions on them which isn't on the menu as being on a club sandwich. Nowhere close to what I asked for. And I was the only customer in the store, so they didn't seem so busy that they could have gotten my order confused with someone else. Very disappointed, will not be coming back.

resp.text: Hey guys, this is Joe, the owner. So sorry for the mix-up. If you could send us an email, I would like to make it right.

At that point I walked out and got lunch somewhere else.

name: Jason Mack
text: This has to be the worst experience for any subway I've been in! We had been on the road for a couple of hours, kids hungry. Decided to stop at this subway, HUGH mistake and a waste of time! Came in, both girls did not want to be there. 1st order, meatball sub. Answer, we don't have meatballs! WHAT? Out of meatballs. Ok I'll ask kids to pick something else. 2nd order, spicy Italian. Answer, we are out of pepperoni and...... I never let her finish. Walked out! How can you own a sandwich shop and be out of meats to make sandwiches? Why open for the day? What a joke! STAY AWAY from this subway, unless you want to buy bread!

name: Tyler Toner
text: Great service and tasty sandwiches from the very friendly Sonia!

name: Dennis Byrnes
text: Really tasty subs. Some of the food preparer's really don't want to be there. So they have an attitude when making your sub. Kinda skimp on the toppings.

name: Elaine Coleman
text: Good food. Nice people

name: M A Bumgar
text:
I have never been treated so rudely.  After multiple incidents, I finally walked away without my order.  She had one person's order she was making when we arrived.  She asked us what we wanted and I told her we wanted 4 sandwiches so we'd wait for her to finish and check out the woman already there.  She complained that she was all alone and she didn't want to avoid taking off her gloves to save time.  So then when we tried to tell her our order, she kept asking what we wanted, and I kept repeating it every time she kept saying it wrong.   Then after several go arounds she said she'd fix the sandwiches but we needed to tell her what we want. I said I had and asked if she could hear me, and she said she couldn't because there was too much noise.  That was about the time another customer came in.  So I spoke louder and began repeating the order once again, and she interrupted me and told me to hold that thought.  And then proceeded to finish and wrap the sandwiches for the woman ahead of us very very very slowly.  At around this point in time, I looked and it was 4:06 pm.  We had pulled into the parking lot at about 3:51, and upon entering the store I briefly looked at produce then went into the restaurant.   She made several remarks through the course of this time she had started with our order at  about 416. She said she had problems just like me and that the customer wasnt always right and that she wasnt disrespecting me.  Yeah right.  I was in an amigo so these things she bent down and said then through the glass. Then asked me if I understood her.  I told her I didn't.   I heard her but I had no understanding of what she was trying to communicate.  Her response to that was "see, now you know what I mean". The woman behind me told the little girl with her not to say a word to this employee because she was frustrated because she was working alone.

She mixed up the sandwiches, and instead of 2 BMTs, there was 1 and 2 hams instead 1.  This is when I realized she had put pickles and mayo on the wrong sub.  My husband said he didnt want it with the mayo on it.  So i tried to tell her he wasnt going to pay for it and she told me she would  throw them out and had another customer, so I needed to decide what I wanted.

I have never been treated so rudely and it wasn't just what she said , it was how she said it.  It was 4:23 when I finally gave up.  I walked over to a Walmart customer service person to see if I could talk to the subway manager but she and 2 others didnt seem to know anything about it.

So... at 4:26, we exited the store, and drove a few miles away to the Subway in town across from Dollar General.   There were 3 employees there, all of whom were very pleasant and the subs were bagged before I paid for them.  The time on the receipt was 4:45. This is the sub shop to do business with.

So if you want good and prompt service stay away from the Walmart Subway.   The employee who was rude had a name tag on.  I would never post it, but I
Will check before I ever order there again to make sure I never have to deal with her foul personality again.

name: Jay Whaley
text: Extremely friendly service ready to help give an amazing sub with quick turnaround.

name: Roan M Barker
text: I was at Wal-Mart not Subway

name: Lea Tillman
text: Very Good!

name: Sharon Thompson
text: Don't eat subway

name: Gerald O. Gurganus II
text: I've had several bad experiences at this location. I will give you the 2 that stand out. The first bad experiences was when I was ordering my food there was a roach crawling on the meatballs. The 2nd bad experiance. At 5:00 PM my family went in to order sandwiches. My wife started giving her order then an employee comes from the back and makes the other employee stop making our sandwiches. Because the bread was already sold. When my wife asked what do you mean? They stated the bread was for door dash orders. Then told her if she would like a sandwich she could come back in 30 minutes  after they make more bread.

name: Sandy
text: The lady there tonight was very nice. She worked very hard, but was by herself. It got extremely busy during the time we were there. Literally 10 people in line AND call in orders. I understand that you don't know when it's going to get busy, but I feel really bad the lady had to go through that tonight.

Horrible service on Wednesday March 31around
1pm. 2 female employees that were so immature I’ll never go back

name: Julia Shelton
text: Sandwiches good. Almost always out of guacamole. Employee really struggled figuring out "special" 2 footlongs for $10 or 1/2 sandwich buy one get one free seemed to be quite difficult for her to figure out.

name: Brandy Butler
text: This is a very poorly maintained Subway they do not care about the quality of their product they are often out of stock and extremely sloppy I do do not recommend this subway to anyone......I worked for a subway for alot of years and this restaurant is poorly managed service is horrible

name: Donna Wilson
text:
I have been in several times and they are not up to standards. The lettuce was browning once and the meatballs were so old they were hard. I’m not a fan of this one. Do yourself a favor and drive a few more miles to a better one!
Side note...the employees have always been pleasant.

name: Suyapa Banchon
text: Food good, customer service good.

name: February Armstrong
text: Clean restaurant. Employess here are always nice and do a very good job making the subs. Their cookies are soft which is what i have a problem with at most of the subways. Their ingredients are always fresh also

name: Barbara Prewett
text: Depends on which one you go to... Some locations are great

name: Brianna Melvin
text: I have never met a store, or worked in one for that matter, that didn't try to upsell. I am a manager at a pizza hut now and that's the point. To give customers the best bang for their buck. I sent my stepdad to subway for sandwiches for my husband and I. I knew the sub i wanted was a $5 sub and my husband's would cost a little more. I gave him the money I had and told him to get us foot long sandwiches. He says the lady didnt specify, which i understand, but i paid $4  for a 6" sub when the woman could have informed him for $1 MORE HE COULD HAVE GOTTEN A FOOTLONG! needless to say, i ate my sub and my husband ate his. Plus the food my mother and stepfather got tasted bad and he wanted to bring it back. My point, you should at least INFORM YOUR CUSTOMERS SO THEY CAN MAKE THE BEST DECISION BASED ON THEIR MONEY. For 1 dollar more I could have had twice the sandwich. If i could give 0 stars i would. This is my first review on this subway and i never try to give bad reviews working in the food industry myself. But i will not EVER use this subway again. I will go out of my way to bypass this one.

name: jon shook
text: Always a good choice when eating never had a bad meal or experience

name: Kaylan Hand
text: HORRIBLE. I went at 9 AM this morning to get a sandwich on white bread. They open at 7 AM. The lady whose name I do not recall, told me the bread would not be ready for another 30 minutes. They have been open for two hours. Yes, I could understand being open for 30 minutes and not having the bread done, but two hours is absolutely ridiculous. So, I travelled to another subway up the road to see if the situation was the same. The man in this store was very friendly as he already had his bread done. I called the manager of this subway of which I experienced the bread not being done and she informed me that it was not a priority nor the first thing they do. If you do not have your bread done by time you open, simply change your hours. It is SO RUDE for customers to be under the impression that they can "eat fresh" when they can't even eat at all. While on the phone with this manager, I asked if all the subways did this. She replied with "no.. wait I mean yes." I explained to her I went to another subway directly 10 minutes after I was told there was no white bread done but he seemed to have all of his stuff together. She informed me that it could have been left over bread from yesterday, but it was not. Guess he is just more concerned with keeping his job and keeping the customers happy than having them complain about stupid bread situations. This subway does not even deserve one star.

name: Joy Hines
text: Everytime I have been in there they do not have the personal pizzas. If it was not for my family loving subway and it being near our home I would never go back to this particular subway again.

The service is terrible HEATHER is extremely rude and seems to have very poor hygiene for someone who is handling food for a living. not only was the service the worst but she did a piss poor job with preparing my food . i would rather eat the gas station food from the chevron up the street!!!!!

text: The young lady that was serving us was very quick and thorough but it's absolutely unacceptable that she was the only person working. There's no way to restock the food and have everything on hand the customers need. there was several items out of stock because she just didn't have the time to prepare for the next batch. Shame on the owner for not providing some help.

name: American Girl
text: Visited this morning and it wasn’t busy. The girl never said one work to me, but the staff here is never very friendly. I’m not sure how “fresh” any of Subways food is, the meat never looks good to be so I always get all veggie. But overall I have never had an major issue here.
