Due to the recent pandemic, we have had to make a lot of changes at our Mellow Mushroom. So, our hours have been shortened to allow for adequate cleaning/ sanitizing while no guests are in the building. Our current hours are 11a-8pm. Again, I apologize and have made sure that we are handling every situation better in these crazy times!

name: criasia
text:
We frequent mellow mushroom almost monthly and love the pizza.  This is a review specifically for the female manager on shift 9 March 2019 at 6:30 pm.  She was very rude and I figured I should share.

I ordered pizza for take out and went to pick it up.  I got to the restaurant about 6:30 and went to the bar area to pick it up.  The lady behind the bar asked my name and immediately told me my pizza wasn't ready yet.  I said that's fine and sat where I could see the take out orders sitting on top of the oven.  I noticed a take out order matching my size boxes sitting there, but figured they weren't mine, as that's what the lady said.  None the less, I happened to notice they weren't going anywhere and began to figure they were mine.  After 20 mins of waiting, the lady went and picked up those very same boxes from on top of the oven and brought them to me.  I mentioned that they had been sitting there since before she told me that my order wasn't ready and that I wasnt pleased with that.

She began to tell me I was a liar and that it was impossible.  That I had confused those boxes with other take out.  She then told me to feel how hot the pizzas were and I mentioned that they were warm because they had been sitting on top of the oven for the last 20 minutes.  It was quite a weird feeling to be told i was crazy and listen to several complete lies about my pizza that i had been watching for the last 20 mins.  long story short, it was a super uncomfortable situation and the lying manager should probably be disciplined.

I will continue to frequent mellow mushroom, cause the pizza is delicous.

name: Kristal Price
text: If they would let me rate a zero i would. I went to eat their with my family tonight and this is what happened. 1. Waitress took our order. She brung our drinks pretty fast. 10 minutes later she brung us plates and napkins and no silverware. 2. We ordered our food and it took us at least an hour before we got our appetizer. Then another 15 minutes for me to get a salad. Now the waitress did not bring me my salad the hostess did. Who also was very nice to bring me silverware. Ok then my son got his little cheese pizza and apples. That meal was perfect. My salad wasnt even great. I had the wrong lettuce. Ok 30 minutes later my daughter gets her pretzel dippers and they were almost as big as her and hard as all get out. You could have broken a glass with it. Ok about another 30-35 minutes past and my husband still has not gotten his calzone. It finally arrives and its cold. The waitress has not even checked on us since we got our drinks. The hostess again was nice enough to bring him silverware after we tried to get the attention of our server for about 10 minutes. They said they would take off my daughters meal bc it was an aweful meal and she didnt even get her apple slices then they still charge us for it. It was the worst meal i have ever eaten there.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know where we have fallen short.  We will do better moving forward.  Stay mellow.

name: Michael Earls (cerkit)
text:
We toggle between dining in and takeout. We eat a LOT of this pizza. We recently ordered a pizza with "everything" on it (except tomatos and pepperoni) and it was delicious. I was full after a single piece.

When we dine in, I usually order the avocado hoagie without onions. It's AWESOME. If not the hoagie, we sometimes share a calzone with ham and pineapple. It's enough food for the two of us.

Like I said, we eat here often. This restaurant is just as good as any of the locations in Georgia that we've been to. Somehow, we always get lucky enough to live in locations with a Mellow Mushroom nearby. Thank goodness Prattville was no different.

And then the patty was so small as if it was the one that they usually put on the big macs. The quarter pounder usually have the 1/4 pound size which is way thicker than the patty that I received and it was dried out. They didn't give us the BBQ sauce for the chicken nuggets nor did they indicate which tea was which. A large drink usually costs .99 cents plus tax but their's was overpriced at $1.29. It's sad that we had to drive way out of the way because our usual McDonald's didn't have any power right along with us because of the storm then have to pay more to receive less than good food.

name: Ben
text: I never realized it was possible to be too incompetent to run a McDonald’s even somewhat efficiently until trying to get food at this location. The one time they somehow managed to get me through the drive-thru within the span of an hour they still somehow got the order wrong when I was one of two cars there. Tonight I thought I’d give them another chance and grab some food on the way into work. I thought wrong. I pull up to the drove through and there’s maybe 4 cars there including me so it was by no means a rush, especially for normal dinner hours, so I thought “nice, I should be able to get my food and make it to work in plenty of time!” I thought wrong. So it takes about 10 minutes for the 2 cars in front of me to get their orders in and it thought “ This is fine, they probably just have some big/complicated orders.” I thought wrong. I get to the window and the operator says “one moment please.” So it thought “that’s fine, he’s probably gotta take care of a simple task real quick.” I thought wrong. After more than 5 minutes of waiting at the speaker I had to just leave the line as I would’ve been late to work had I waited the whole time it would’ve taken to get my food. Some say the people who were ahead of me in line are still waiting to get their order or for it to be correct to this day. So in short, save yourself the trouble and go to a different restaurant, especially if you’re on any kind of a schedule that doesn’t permit an hour of waiting, unless you want to leave a McDonald’s angry, hungry, or probably both.

name: Maureen Henderson
text: Have been craving your quarter pounder with cheese for weeks. Had it last night and was so sick all night less than 3 hours after I ate it. I specifically asked for a fresh one, whether it was old or fresh it gave me severe food poisoning. Monitor your food temperature better and your kitchen staff's hand washing and cleanliness practices. Will not be back and strongly suggest other customers to be careful at this location.

text: The most unprofessional place I have ever encountered. When we entered the building, it appeared they were preparing to close the lobby, even though it was only 9:30 and the sign said the lobby was open until midnight. When ordering, I witnessed staff with their pants sagging, off shift coworkers interfering with customers placing orders, crew members cursing in full view of customers and one crew member answering a facetime call. At 9:45, the cashier closed and locked the door, even refusing entry to customers and telling them to go to the drive through.  Never in my life have I ever been witness to these behaviors. I am an ASM at another store and I would have fired my staff for these behaviors. I will never patronize this establishment again.

My issues come with the night shift. Within 2 weeks I go to get some breakfast or something around 12 to 3 am there seems to be a issue with me ordering food. Either they ignore the drive-thru line to where customers just leave or they only give me limited choices to a already small menu. It's to a point where it makes me feel like they don't want to cook the food so they don't have to clean.

Update 5/4/19 I sat at the drive-thru for about 2 minutes and got ignored.. decided to pull around to the window and still got ignored as people walk through the store.
They eventually came to the window and told me that their system is down and it's getting ready for breakfast @3:00am

You should properly train your employees to explain to the customers how long this process takes or teach them to have enough courtesy to answer the drive-through when people are sitting there waiting.

She couldn’t even come to the window to personally say it. So I drove somewhere else to find something quick to eat and had no luck. BUT when I drove back by they had people at the window and people walking in. Worst place ever. They definitely need to just close this one down. Everyone there is rude and lazy.

I was so determined to let people's know how horrible the service was that I found this site on the web to do just that. Very disappointed with the food served....

text: Grrr. One employee. Seriously. Good food but service is spotty. I eat here about once a month and never seem to see the same workers.  Yesterday they only had one guy during lunch rush. It is most often not crowded and they do make a good sandwich but you may have to wait for it.

name: Trent Ridlehoover
text:
So whomever made my sandwiches for my family was amazing.

But the rude obnoxious coworker morven or however you spell his name was incredibly rude to his coworker and had kicked his feet up in a booth feet all sprawled out trash all over the booth while letting his coworker do everything. And when asked for help he was just astounded someone asked him to do his job. I come here multiple times a week and everyone is usually super friends or super fast, one or the other. But this dude was just a total butt to his co worker and it would’ve been embarrassing to be him in this situation.

text: Best subway in the area. Nice welcoming staff and quick. Much better than the one on Lorna road. Will make the longer drive just to come here.

name: LaVa Darby
text: 3 of your employees harassed me for taking pictures and your store was in Covid-19 violation of allowing an outsider bring in their own cup

name: C J K
text: Sandwiches are decent. The elderly woman behind the counter in a small town counted out each pickle, 4 total, each piece of bell pepper, 4 little slivers, each jalapeño, 4 total, etc....on a foot long. For an $8 sandwich, Subway, quit counting and skimping on the cheap stuff, meats I can understand using the measured amount but I feel very confident that your bulk oder veggies come with a pretty hefty discount, so why count. I go to Publix for sandwiches now anytime I can because their sandwiches are better and they have no problem loading you down with a salad on your sandwich if that's what you want, pretty much the same price too. Obviously a way better meat selection too.....I know I'm not comparing apples to apples there, just stating a fact though.q

text: Great Sandwich shop, tasty food, friendly staff.

name: Charlie Griffin
text: How do you run out of meatballs and bread at 11:30 AM?

name: Moonstar79
text:
Everyone knows about Subway. Everyone understands what they're getting when they walk into the building. The customer service is generally sub-par, although once in a blue moon you'll get a duo that work together quite well. Again, though, this is rare, and the usual default is that one person behind the counter does all the work while the other takes perpetual breaks, as is the case in my local Subway. The food itself is actually not bad, as long as your cravings are in stock (and they often might not be). On the upside, it's usually a very relaxed environment with no rush on your order. On the downside, can you say cross-contamination? But don't like my experience affect yours. Perhaps you'll come out having rung the Perfect Bell.
Or perhaps not.

name: Gil Ellis
text: Went there for lunch waited 15 minutes before getting to order only for them to tell me that they did not have any steak terrible place to go has a bunch of kids working there i will not go back there is a better sub place go to Firehouse Subs.

text: I come to this location about 2 times a week and Yesnia is always pleasant everytime i come. She is a very hard worker i sit in and eat, and when she has no customers, she is always working nonstop to ensure the place is clean and stocked. I love Subway😍😍😍

name: Sose Knows Best
text: My husband and I got the rotisserie chicken and by time we drove not even a 2 minute drive home, both of our sandwiches were soggy and the meat was ice cold and wet! Never really cared for this place they’re always understaffed and slow. This will be our last time eating here.

name: Anna Gleason
text: Had a low to mediocre experience here. Friendly workers, but the guy who made my food forgot to put my cookie I paid for in the bag and then the food was undercooked and made me sick. I think he was new and like I said he was friendly but needs improvement.

name: Rodney Patton
text:
I was visiting family in the area today and stopped by this subway for the first time.   When I walked in, there was a semi long line.  I was about to turn around and go somewhere else until I noticed the young man behind the counter. He was the only employee in the building from what I could tell.  He is probably a manager. Maybe not but he seemed to be by the way he was carrying himself. If he is not he should at least be considered for a management position.
He was moving as fast as he could.  More importantly, (and the reason why I decided to stay and wait in line) he was having a great time talking to the customers and didn't seem to be discouraged by his circumstances.  Customers were laughing and talking and actually ENJOYING their time WAITING in line.   I've owned and sold customer service and hospitality related  companies before and you do not typically see customers that enjoy waiting. For any amount if time or for any thing   This young man, Steven or Steve, is the reason why I stayed.   I enjoyed my conversation with him and my time in line as well. As a former/semi retired franchisee, I can tell you, this employee will do great things for your company.
Everything was great on my visit. I even met some people in line who I would not have typically spoken to. All because if the atmosphere that was created by one employee.  Food was fresh and perfect.  I would recommend this subway over any others.

name: Robyn Counts
text: My husband and I went to eat here at 9:40pm tonight. My husband walked in first and the employee looked at him with a face of disgust. Like he didn't want another customer.  Then tell him they are out of bread?? Really? Every single kind of bread happens to be out. Lazy as he**. Then drive 10 minutes to the lakeshore Walmart to eat at that subway...but they closed at 10:04 instead of 10:30. I'm beginning to think all Subways have lazy employees.

name: Sassha M
text: The worker, Jehki, who took my order was VERY polite, friendly, and customer service oriented. I just wanted the unwich but she asked me did I want to add a drink, chips, or cookie to my order which I declined. She also asked me was I a rewards member and explained to me the benefits of becoming a rewards member. I had a short wait time while my order was fixed and I like the fact that everyone had on masks and gloves adhering to safety precautions.

resp.text: We are sorry for your experience, that’s not how we roll. Please reach out to our customer service team here: http://bit.ly/JJsFeedback and we’ll share your feedback with the local store’s owner.

It's a good sandwich if you are in a bind and want to be filled with natural cut meats and cheeses but the customer service bites the big one. Everytime I call I get some boo boo Felicia that acts as though I'm inconveniencing her. They interrupt, are rude and really just don't seem to care about you at all. I had to yell to make sure that she didn't hang up on me with her assumption as to my address, phone number or method of pay. Seriously disappointed with this location in Mobile, AL.

I open the sandwich and it is an egg McMuffin instead of the sausage egg and cheese McMuffin I ordered. I hopped in my ride and went back. After explaining that I received the wrong sandwich the young lady said “ so you need a piece of sausage?” I looked at her like she was some kind of special and said “ No, I need the whole sandwich.” What in the world? Then I come back for dinner to give them a second chance and mistake will not return

Someone walked in from street with a cup and helped himself to the soda machine and walked back out; meanwhile a bunch of students from nearby  high school, poured in loudly, cursing disrespectfully in front of everyone; horse-playing and just lounged around. Management contributes to the LOUD chaos, and disruption by yelling orders to crew members and holding loud discussions; the entire lobby could hear them all...unprofessional interactions with customers and more. text:
My star rating is based on comparing fast food establishments and not real restaurants that actually take pride in their food and the service they provide.
That being said, the newly refurbished McDonalds seem to be more efficient regarding customer through-put but when it comes to what the customers care about,  i.e. getting our orders right( or even close), they are still the same old McDonalds with a fresh coat of paint.

text: Don't know what's happened to this McDonalds, but the service has really gone downhill. I waited about five minutes in the drive thru line (at 6:30 pm), finally got to the pick up window and was told I would need to park and they would bring my order out to me. I asked if the delay was due to my cheeseburgers or fries and was asked, ''Didn't you order two egg McMuffins?". Nope - cheeseburgers and fries. Two minutes later, she comes back and says (again) that I'll have to park and wait. FIFTEEN minutes later after eight other cars have received their orders, they finally bring mine out. Guess what it is - egg Mcmuffins! Back inside they go (with my receipt). Five minutes later they bring my order out. I get home and my cheeseburger has no cheese and one end has been dipped in ketchup and fries are cold. I really think management and staff couldn't care less about customers...

name: Brian Cox
text:
Firehouse makes a pretty decent sub. This place was packed though and took way too long for what is a simple meal.

It's usually better about getting your meal ready but who knows, maybe it was just an off day.

They continue to have the best bucket prices in town so if you need buckets for anything and don't mind a lingering pickle smell for a while you should buy them here and not a box store.

resp.text:
We're sorry to hear about the less than stellar wait time, Brian. We appreciate you being a fan of the food and taking the time to let us know about your experience. name: TIMOTHY JAMES
text: Every time I go to any Firehouse Subs, my order is always complete, the staff is always professional and courteous, and the food is always fresh and hot. Today, I utilized the app to pick up at 8pm. I only live 5 minutes from this restaurant and when I got home not only was my order wrong but my food was cold. I placed my order around 7:15 to pick up at 8pm. I think they made the food early and just allowed it to sit until I picked it up. I've  posted several reviews on different Firehouse Subs restaurants but today this particular restaurant did very poorly.

resp.text:
We value every one of our guests and their feedback, Timothy. Comments such as yours help us to continue to learn what areas we can improve upon. If you are willing, please contact the general manager of the restaurant. That way, they can discuss your experience as well as a resolution to the issues you listed in your review. We hope to hear from you soon!
Sabrina/Guest Services

name: Karen KR
text: Last night was maybe the 2nd time that we went to this location. We had 3 sandwiches in our order. While they were in the little oven (toaster...whatever you call it) the oven caught fire. Needless to say we didn't get any food, they refunded our money and gave us 2 brownies for our time. Mind you it was already after 8pm. I appreciate that the employee tried to make up for it but it was already a bad evening and this topped it off. I do hope that the fire department was called and came to make sure everything was good.

resp.text:
Thank you for bringing your recent visit to our attention, Karen. We want to assure you that your issues and concerns have been shared with the proper leadership to review. Thank you again. Have a wonderful day!

name: Anna Elkins
text: My mom and I had a great dinner! We were greeted as we walked in by the cashier. She had a visual diagram of the sandwiches sizes that was very helpful. I got the Club on a Sub with the Loaded Potato soup. It was very hard to choose between all the tasty looking sides. My mom ordered the Turkey Bacon Ranch sandwich, as well as a sandwich to go for lunch tomorrow. Needless to say we had a complicated order! But they killed it! Everything came out perfect and the cashier even offered to leave her to go sandwich cold so it didn't wilt. Gave her packages of mayo/mustard on the side, too! It's always nice to support a place that gives back to our community, like the $80k they have given to Columbus fire/relief. We will be back!

name: Ashley Havener
text:
Today my husband and I went in around 2pm to get some sandwiches to go. They were just a little busy nothing a well trained staff couldn't handle.

We ordered a streak and cheese no mayo, and 2 medium Italians no mayo with pepperoncinis.

1st problem they didn't even know where on the cash register pepperoncinis were so she said she would just write it in.

2nd problem when we got home and opened our food to start eating the were no pepperoncinis on the Italians and so little cheese you couldnt even find it if you were looking. The streak and cheese was streak only.

The staff of about 5 or 6 people seemed scared and overwhelmed by the very small rush they had. When I say small I mean there was maybe 12-15 people most of whom already had their food.

text: I finally decided to give this place a try and I'm glad I did. This is a really nice and cozy place to eat. It's extremely clean and the staff is friendly.  I tried one of their pizzas and it was pretty good. I also got my food pretty fast. They also have a complimentary section with jalapenos, pickles, cheese, and more. I will be coming back for sure.

name: Mariah Glass
text: Our 1st time there. I had planned to try a pizza per the good reviews but the seasonal French dip won me over. Very good, the meat was cut nice and thick. The Au jus sauce had a nice flavor. I had it as it comes with no substitutes, the flavors were good and hearty.  We also tried the club sandwich which I was told was very good also. Crab and lobster bisque was better than some I  had in Florida. Staff and management very friendly and hospitable. We dined around 7:30pm on a Sunday and the atmosphere was cozy and relaxed. We picked up some of their chicken salad and lobster bisque soup from the to go market section. Nice feature especially if you need to grab something quick.  Chicken salad has pecans, celery and grapes in it, tasty but I like a few more grapes myself 😊. Nice experience, will definitely return!

text: Solid service and a nice place for soup and salad

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

text: I love their salads and I used to get the Raspberry Vinaigrette dressing but for no apparent reason, they stopped having it as an option. Please bring back the dressing, it's my favorite. - Thanks

name: Jessica Andersen
text: came here on a friday i think. looking forward to a return visit. prices were decent.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Denise Ruiz
text:
Ok. So we have been waiting for a long time to try this place out since we didn't want to drive to Auburn to try that one.
First walk in it is very impressive and a very nice re do on the Atlanta Bread Co layout.  Friendly staff and very fast service from the time you order. We arrived at 11 right when they opened since it has been very busy but from the moment you go inside, the order counter is right in the doorway which doesn't allow much space to wait to place your order.
The soups are to die for and the salad was amazing. The pesto chicken sandwich was a bit much for my liking . It had too much pesto and almost no chicken.
The only main thing why I couldn't give it 5 stars was the fact that like every 2 minutes Andrew was coming by talking to us. I mean , ok, maybe we are more introverted than most but come on, we couldn't take a bite and here he was back again talking to us and trying to clear our plates. We joked about the next time we would go back we would get our food to go so we could enjoy it.
The kids got a pizza which OMG was sooooo good . Couldn't understand what the big deal was to just put pepperoni on half but no big deal really.
We def wanna go back and try other items on the menu for sure.

name: Lesa Monk
text: I LOVE the place.  The Tortilla soup is great!  And the Caesar salad was wonderful.  Try the pizza, crust is great.

name: Cherokee Bailey
text: My husband and I had a great time eating here.  The food is very good and even the new service since Covid19 came out was good.  The new atmosphere in the restaurant was very friendly and we had a great time.  He has pizza, and I had the mac and cheese  and we share the salad, our favorite salad is the black and blue.  We love blue cheese dressing. Lol. The roast beef is very good in the salad though.  They have a variety of food and so far all food we have had there, has been to die for. ..haha  my husband and I have found out that it's steak slices and not roast beef in the black and blue salad...

resp.text: We really appreciate your thoughts and feedback and look forward to continuing to service you as a customer!

name: Linda Churlin
text: Ok food is always good

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback! We truly value your input.

text: Super tasty and clean. Staff was great will be going back

name: Kevin Ray
text: Fresh, good food. Amazing staff with southern charm.

name: Kevin Ray
text: Fresh, good food. Amazing staff with southern charm.

name: Inja Gordon
text:
The direction in coming into this establishment is not a "good flow"... I didn't see anyone at EITHER cash register so as I went to take my mother to the restroom I came back up and asked where do I place my order order as there still wasn't anyone present at any register. I went to the front with one of the ladies. I asked her about her suggestions and I order d a sandwich based on it with a fruit cup for my mother. I ordered a veggie pizza with no artichokes, no olives, no goat cheese and no basil garnish with a large bottle of Acqua Panna spring water. Whwn was all said and done we BOTH went through the order THREE times but there were STILL a few discrepancies. I was never offered a bottle opened for a NONscrew top so as the lady looked at me struggling thinking why would they give nonscrew top without offering to open it? I walked up and a male came to me and asked me did I need help? The same lady who took my order then came by me and asked me did I need help and I told her this was not a screw off top and sarcastically said that was I supposed to open this with my teeth. She just walked away. The guy said sorry about that and opened it. Sat down and soon after the food was brought to us by the same girl and I noticed my mother was looking extra hard at the fruit cup. I asked her what was wrong and she didn't want it... I asked her was everything okay until I saw the hair on the fruit. Totally disgusted I took it up to he kitchen and told the same girl who seemed to dismiss that there was hair on the fruit and said would you like chips instead. I got my mother her chips (at least I know that we had a better chance of it being sanitary since it was in a bag). When I finally was about to eat my pizza that was clearly on the burnt side I noticed that there was an ingredient that I specifically asked NOT to have on my pizza that was still put on my pizza. Side note my mother said the turkey sandwich was not that bad. When I came in here there was one couple and one last sitting by herself. There is no reason why this place was not spotless, better service and customer care. Future reference if you want to have a successful business the following is crucial: good customer service, CLEANLINESS, attentiveness. I will not come back. Please check your food and proceed with caution.

UPDATE: I spoke with CURT(IS) and explained the whole situation. He was extremely receptive and apologetic. He also offered to reimburse me but I refused stating that maybe he could provide a free meal to someone else. Hopefully, he can get some of his staff retrained and to standard.

name: joe johnson

text: Food was good. Pricey for amt you get. Side of pasta salad-maybe 2 tablespoons. Grilled steak sand skimpy on steak for $9. But like the guy said, "free" bread sticks. Honestly, not worth the $24 for lunch for 2 people!

name: Danielle Sanders
text: Love the avacado shrimp salad !!! Friendly staff and clean place !!

name: Linda Martin
text: Service with a Smile.  Nice & personal.  If you have a Q - answered politely & all have great attitude.  Clean bathroom.  Always enjoy my food & will continue eating there with family & friends.

name: SnailLord
text: Went here yesterday and I’m 100% sure the cashier was high. He stared at the screen blankly for quite some time, asked us what we ordered multiple times then went back to staring at the screen. He then said our order back to us about five times over, and even then he got the entire order wrong. The whole ordering process lasted at least five minutes for a simple order of Mac and cheese with a salad. We stood there correcting him time and time again while a line formed behind us waiting for their turn. I couldn’t even get a good look at this guy’s face because his hat was pulled so far down to hide it. I used to really like going here, but if that guy is the cashier again I will not be coming back.

name: Miranda Dennis
text: We haven’t ate here since it was closed due to the virus and we picked up food today and I am really disappointed. We ordered my son the kids Mac and cheese and the container was not even 1/3 full of macaroni. He could’ve ate it in a few bites. Waste of money! I don’t think we are going to frequent this restaurant anymore.

name: Dennis Moore
text: Roast beef sandwich is very good. Although advertised as medium rare,  it was overdone. Also, a couple spots where there wasn't any meat. I had to open it up and rearrange it which left a thin covering. The sides seem a little small for the price.  All that said. It was still very good and we will return again and again. Friendly staff and clean environment. Job well done

name: steven howard
text: Very good food

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

text: Clean and my salad was awesome!! Staff super friendly. Got our food fast . I'll be going back

name: Autumn MoonPetal
text: I love the casual environment, it doesnt feel weird to come to eat alone. The food is Great! My favorite so far is the Spicy Shrimp Pizza!

name: Powell Smith
text: We really enjoy this place for their pick two combos. My wife gets the soup and salad and I get the soup and sandwich. The tomato basil soup and the half roast beef sandwich are great! Servings are large so get the cup of soup and half salad/sandwich unless you are sharing or just incredibly hungry. Prices seem a little high until you taste the quality and see the serving sizes!

name: Roger Garms
text: Good food selections and very tasty. Best bread & butter pickles I've ever tasted.

name: Gabriel Smith
text: Great sandwiches, split the Italian and the chicken salad with my wife. Both top notch.

name: NICOLE TORRANCE
text: First time eating here. Went with family. Food was EXCELLENT!!! Will go back again mos def ❤

name: Miriam Eve Tidwell
text:
The food is different from most fast food places. The meals taste home made. You can taste the ingredients.
Every person that worked there was smiling and helpful. You don't clear your own plates up.
Salads are huge. Ask up front for less arugula. We had the shrimp and avocado salad. Lots of shrimp and a huge portion of avocados. We also had the chicken soup. Had an eastern flavor.  The Cesar salad was full of ingredients. And they have a table with all kinds of extras like pickles and croutons, watermelon rinds, oinions etc...
Pizza may just be the best I have ever had.
I had the Margarita and my husband had the Mediterranean with chicken. The flavors were perfect together.
Last we tried the rich and creamy lobster bisk. Pow we were stuffed!
This my folks, will require many do overs!

name: joe johnson
text: Food was good but stuff was very unprofessional. We were sitting by the drinks and staff was drinking in front of drink machines. A waitress was cleaning up the drink area while coughing all over and talking about getting off work. This will be my last time coming here for sure

resp.text: We are sorry to hear this. Our number one priority is the guest and their visit. We will let our management team know so we can fix this. Thank you.

name: Tawya Thomas
text: I would like to know how did the staff get so friendly. That is definitely a plus. It is pretty busy today however everything is moving very quickly. Greeted me with a smile and took my order with ease. Restaurant looks absolutely amazing. The food was delicious. The macaroni and cheese was so creamy and cheesy what a little twist. Everything is going great. The sandwich was fresh the ingredients to Fresh every taste complimented each other. Thank you so much for my experience. I'm glad that you are here.

resp.text: Hi Tawya! Thank you very much for your wonderful review! We work really hard to offer the best food in a welcoming environment. Hope to see you again soon !

name: Shanon Collum
text: Awesome food and staff

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Shaina Merine
text: Always good!  I love their salads especially the Chicken Caesar salad.  The club sandwich and broccoli cheddar soup is great too!  And dont forget a slice of cake!  Both the strawberry and caramel cakes are delicious!  Never a bad experience and I've ordered from here too many times to count!

name: Dottie Adams
text: A few years ago while my husband was in med school, Newks was a go-to location for his study spot. I ate many a meal there while he studied with his classmates in the evening. Ever since then, I've been hooked and was happy when this Columbus location opened. The staff there do work really hard to provide a nice experience. I'd recommend trying the Ultimate salad or the Spicy Shrimp Pizza. Both are great! Lunch does get busy, but evenings are a bit quieter. Overall a nice place to grab a quick meal or a great place to hang out for a bit.

name: Emily Culpepper
text: I work here and I love it. I love some of the customers and all the employees. Its a great place to visit and eat every once in a while. Its expensive

name: Amy Sibley
text: Delicious sandwiches, soups, pizzas. Great for quick bite, families, or lunch meeting.

name: Cindy Lehman Dunning
text: Love the loaded potato soup!!

name: Lorraine Brown
text:
Good place for a delicious yet healthy lunch. Soups, salads, sandwiches are all fresh.
Quiet enough to read the paper. Tables well spaced so that a small gathering of friends would not feel claustrophobic.

Management not knowledgeable about the food (I asked about the lower calorie options on the outside menu) and did not offer to find out. My friends liked their pizzas. Not worth going back for me.

text: I came here on a date with my boyfriend. Everyone was very nice, but when we got in out 4 cheese pizza, it was very greasy and messed with both of our stomachs. We decided that this was because it was the first thing we ate that day and got a to go box. IT LITERALLY WAS SO GREASY THAT IT SOAKED THROUGH THE BOX. Don’t get the pizza from here. I did go back and get a sandwich from this place later and it was good, so that’s why I gave it three stars.

name: Vee Bee
text:
Food was horrible, with a bad presentation. The tomato soup tasted as though it was rewarmed with lots of grease floating in it. The pizza was nothing like all of the other Newk's in the Atlanta areas. It was thin, and somewhere between warm and cool although we waited 20 minutes while they 'made' it.
Called to complain the same night, rude young folks literally playing on the phone. I asked for a manager from the start, and got one after repeating myself for approximately 8 minutes. He too was young and offered a poor excuse for the food, particularly the soup. He said that it probably had been out too long. Smh
He offered a credit for the soup that we never picked up.
We swear by Newk's in Dunwoody, and Newnan, GA, but this one in our home town will  NEVER get our business again. They have improvement to do!

name: will compton
text:
I am not one to usually care to write reviews, good or bad, but I felt that this one deserved it:

Tonight I ordered a meal from from Newks Eatery here in Columbus through the app Waitr (DO NOT EVER USE THIS APP THEY ARE HORRIBLE). Everything went smoothly until when I received my order, I realized that two things that I had purchased were missing from my bag. I was frustrated to say the least, so I called the restaurant to have the problem fixed.

I won't go into every little detail about the mess of what happened afterwards with Waitr, but I did want to give a shout out to the manager from Newks, Kayla, that helped me throughout the whole process. She really went above and beyond. Not only did she refund the money for the desserts, she also got a waitr driver back out to her restaurant,  even stayed late after they closed waiting on the driver to pick them up, and also included in an extra half sandwich for my troubles. She promptly called me back every time she had an update, answered my call every time I called, and handled to situation in the most professional and savvy way. She was the only person that saved the day and saved this situation from being an absolute disaster. THANK YOU KAYLA!!!

On a side note - Waitr is the worst, most poorly managed food delivery service company, and really service company in general, that I have ever used. They were the real problem in this whole situation and were basically running around with their heads cut off. Not to mention, this same situation had happened to me before while using the waitr app, this one just happen to top them all and be worse than anytime before. but again KAYLA SAVED THE DAY!

When I  go to Columbus to visit her...I can't wait to try Newk's.

The Mac and cheese was good but the sandwich was totally tasteless.  I ate half the sandwich and left the other half.  Sorry, but the food was bland to me and I don't think I'll be going back.

text:
I dined in Friday and Sunday. Friday night was awful. I waited hours for my pizza. I was angry and hungry. The store looked horrible. I had no idea what was on the round table or what it was until a dread headed server told me while finally serving my food after hours. She was the nicest person I had spoken to at Newks. Sunday was much better. I was greeted very nicely at the door so much enthusiasm especially for the morning time. Some of the servers looked very rude and like they had attitudes when you ask for anything. I luckily got the dread head server again whom remembered me from friday. She greeted us with a smile which was very warming, she is very sweet. Welcomed me back and served my food. Instead of pointing at the round table like the other server did when I asked a question she told me where I could find it and offered to bring it to me. Today the food was much better and out faster. But you really need to fix your servers attitudes and their conversations. One server smelt of marijuana and the to go area two ladies where complaining about customers all morning. I wanted to move away from that area. If you don't like your job quit! The dread head server is also very hot and looks very in shape :)

PIZZA IS THE BEST THING ON THE MENU!!!!!!!!!

name: Gwendolyn Thomas
text: I frequent other Newks and have never had an issue before and if I did, it was handled professionally and with care. Today, I decided to try the one in Columbus, Georgia; well, the cashier was very friendly and very nice to me. I ordered two soups and only received one soup as I didn’t pay attention to my receipt as my total is usually the same every time I go. I alerted the young lady who brought my food to go to me. She got a supervisor or someone in charge to tell her my issue. She was very unprofessional telling me my soup was not free and I would have to pay for it! I then explained to her that I worked daily and can pay for my soup and I didn’t ask for you all to give me the soup for free! I simply asked to fix another one. When she saw I was then frustrated, she tried to “clean it up”! No ma’am! Too late! And to make matters worse, once I drove home, I opened my soup and realized I was given less than half of the soup; which by the way was $3.99! I called the manager Sam and he did not seem to care about my issue all he kept saying was uh huh ok. No, sir! Then, I had to ask him what he was going to do about this to make sure it didn’t happen again and they needed to replace my soup! Overall, I’m very dissatisfied and will continue frequenting the Newks in Newnan where they seem to care about their customers more!! People work hard for their money and expect to be treated kindly!

resp.text: Whoa.  Thanks for letting us know about this.  We want to make this right & get better so it doesn't happen again. We will let our management team know about this.

text: Server didn't change gloves especially after touching the cash register. Did not change gloves between customers orders.

name: Briana Morris
text: Food was pretty good but they had advertisements and posters for the sliders and then when i tried to order some they told me they did not have those.

name: king henry
text:
I was at the Florala Subway today and ask the girl that was going to prepare me a meal to were a mask. She refused and started yelling at me inside the store.

Alabama Governor Kay Ivy has made it mandatory that everyone wears a mask because of COVID 19 spreading.

Where is Subway management in inforcing health rules? What happened to the customer is always right?  I'm sure the sales of this store is underperforming because of its staff.

I am a two-time stage, 4 cancer survivors and I will not put my life at risk. This girl has no clue who her customers are and what kind of health issues they are dealing with.  Staff and management do not care about their customers. Mater of fact the girl screamed that out at me as I walked out of the store.

Avoid this COVID 19 spreading store.

name: Levi Cleland
text: Wonderful fresh best sammich this side of the Mississippi

name: Erin T
text: Delish. Everything seemed to be just as fresh as should be. That sandwich was made just right. The girl listened and did a great job.

name: Teresa Jones
text: Normally I like subway.   But with covid, and everyone being more careful my experience here was so bad I couldn't eat the sandwich even though I was hungry.   The person waiting on me seemed put out anyone was even there, I was the only one in line.  I ask it toasted, which seemed to only make it worse.  My bread was stale, she forgot the Mayo so it was dry, but the worse part she wasn't wearing a mask even though others in the store were and half way through finishing it she rang me up and then went back to finishing my sandwich and handling everything never changing gloves.   Yuck.   I couldn't  bring myself to eat it.  I managed to choke a bite down.   But just couldn't keep going.  Next time I'll just go to Hardee's.

Also, as a walk-in order the staff that build your sub, they are very impatient and rude!!!!! Rolling of eyes and sighing alot. 😞
They do pretty good with the pizzas, no attitude's there.

SO MAYBE IT'S SUBWAY ITSELF OR THAT THE STAFF ARE RUNNING THE REGISTER'S WAITING ON CUSTOMERS THERE.  RUNNING BACK AND FORTH TO SUBWAY.

text: I visit this restaurant many times a year! This is my favorite spot to eat.  I visit this spot regularly. The cooking is of high quality, the staff is polite and the prices are decent. I like being in this restaurant to have a rich dinner.

After he threw the cheese off the sandwich I asked for the managers number. I looked back at him and he said "take a picture itll last longer" wow. The manager took his defense and said maam when we are busy that's how we put the cheese on because they are on a sandwich time limit.... yet had he listened he could have done the sandwich way faster and without being so rude.

The food is always fresh and tasty, the service towards the guests  is helpful. I visit often this restaurant and I not even once was unsatisfied. I recommend it to all my friends.

text: Slow. Quality of my 6" was horrible. I asked for fresher bread and still had half of my bread crumble before I could think of enjoying it. I eat subway in Birmingham all the time and have never experienced this. Plus they gave me dirty napkins. I will never return.

name: Ashley Marques
text: Man at the counter did not want to help me. Said Subway employee would be back. After waiting 5 minutes I asked him how long it would be and he sighed and decided to help me. Then the subway employee appeared and she took over. She was sweet and I appreciate that. Will not be back. Honestly creeps me out that the all the food and stuff is right next to the gas station register.

name: Amber Galvan
text: Had the half salad & soup, I had the lobster & crab bisque & there were shells in the soup. Can provide pictures for proof. I had to clean our table myself. The slaw tasted old. But the staff was nice. That is my only positive note.

resp.text: We really appreciate your thoughts and feedback and look forward to continuing to service you as a customer!

name: Rashmi Karki
text: Awesome taste .worth price and fresh foodie

name: Linda Brown
text: Traveling on I-85 and remembered eating at this Newk's in the past. So called and placed a ToGo order. Order was ready as promised when I went to pick it up. Staff super friendly and food was great. Will definitely return.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: George Martin
text:
Extremely disappointed and uncomfortable.. Visited Newks for the first time on Sunday between 3 and 4 pm. It was empty. Took a while before we were helped. My wife and I both ordered a sandwich and soup. We noticed almost every table had trash and food. I don't mean that in a "every table - but really like 2", I mean well over a dozen at least.. The hostess said, "sorry about the mess, I haven't gotten around to it". We sat outside and it was a disaster. I mean, I've actually never seen something so bad. We were there for over an hour and the hostess never moved. She sat on her phone and never cleaned a single table. The iced tea was not good and I was concerned about sanitation honestly.. I don't think the dispenser has ever been cleaned and I felt like drinking it might make me sick. It tasted off. The chicken salad sandwich was disappointing and the bread was very tough to bite into. The lobster bisque that I was looking forward too must have come pre-made and frozen. All I could taste was cheese. Plastic utensils and 1 napkin each, but I let that pass because it may be a COVID restriction. We had to go and ask for the bill and when I said thank you to the 3 staff working, they just looked at me with dead expressions...

I'm not sure if this is normal or if this is how things run when management isn't around and just young employees are there, but I was actually appalled. Mind you, the state of the restaurant didn't bother me at first - perhaps they were swamped before we got there, but over an hour went by, with us as THE ONLY people there, and they never busted a single table. I did not take a picture because I didn't want to scare people away, but wow... I mean, wow... I only ate half my sandwich because I felt so uncomfortable with the sanitary conditions.

name: Debbie Hodge
text: I had the Newk's Special Salad. It was fresh and very good. It had a special dressing and a variety things on the lettuce- artichokes, grapes, blue cheese, nuts and other good things. I eat at Newk's often and I also like the shrimp and avacado salad.

name: Kim Deal
text: Chicken Salad sandwich is fantastic. Social distancing is enforced, masks are optional.

resp.text: Hi Kim, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We really appreciate it.

name: Jane Chaffee
text: We always stop to eat there wait in town. Awesome

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Susan Davis
text: Went in store at 6:30pm. No one at floor except girl cleaning. All waiters standing around. I had to ask if open shook head yes. Same person came to register I asked if pizza good shook head yes. I asked if she could talk she said yes'm. So I decided if they didnt want my business I left. I am not from there so I will not be going back.

name: Eric Selz
text: The food was awful and extremely overpriced. Friendly and courteous staff got it two stars.

name: Shane Senn
text: Best salads an soups in town love the atmosphere an the homemade cakes

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Becky Culberson
text: Salad was well dressed. Pizza needed longer and more basil but that could be a personal preference.

name: Faye Haag
text: At the Opelika location last night, I  ordered a Margherita pizza. A friend had eaten one there and sent a picture-- looked great. My pizza came with Very Little mozzarella and NO Basil. When I  sent it back, it was returned with a few sprigs of parsley ( I know the difference) and no cheese.  My husband and I  had just left a medical clinic where we had been for a couple of hours. I was tired and hungry and frankly did not want to be That Customer!  Please don't let your kitchen send food out to customers like this! Don't want free food! Just want what's on your menu!

name: Connie Williams
text: Try the pizzas, they are utterly amazing!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-stars! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Taejun Park
text: Spicy Shrimp is the best. Just try it.

name: Amy Hutchins
text: We always enjoy the food. I was really happy with how they are being careful and proactive about keeping things sanitary, clean, and you at peace about not being concerned with anything. They are doing a great job with how they're handling this outbreak.

name: Paula Newton
text: The food was great! But the bathroom floor and toilet are disgusting. I was here two weeks ago and thought they had been busy and not able to attend to it. But I don’t guess that was the case. Same disgusting mess as two weeks ago.

name: Jim Napier
text: Food was perfect. Manager was great.clean. love the salad bar extras.

name: Duane Brown
text: Disappointed this time. Had the caesar salad with seasoned shrimp. Not as good as it used to be.

name: Suzanne Woodall
text: Can't get a better salad anywhere so far. I've looked. Sometimes they are overdressed so I order dressing on the side. I've been to this newks many times (maybe 20) and the salads are consistent. Sandwiches are meh and leave much to be desired. They are mostly bread and little fillings. Soups are OK. I would never order another pizza. We ordered a pizza once with chicken and when we told an employee that the chicken tasted like jerky her reply was "yeah, we don't sell a lot of pizza with chicken because it is really dried out." I had to insist that the uneaten  pizza be removed from our ticket. My kids really enjoy the kids meals. Service is lacking most of the time and the restrooms are nasty more than not. All in all if you want a great salad and maybe an ok cup of soup on a cold day- this is your place. Last time I was there I paid $10 for a half a salad and a bowl of soup with a water. My friend paid $12 for half a sandwich a cup of soup and a tea.

name: Kevin Kinsey
text:
Disappointing. Plain and simple.  Newks is one of our favorite stops foe grabbing lunch but tonight was our first time doing take out and it was not so good.

Ordered two items:

Black and Bleu salad and my wife said it was great.  Fresh. Etc.

Southern Salad (mine) appeared old.  I say this because the lettuce was wilted and dominated by stems.  Had to pick through it to remove all of the 'unsavory' parts. Purple onion was so thickly cut we had to rechop it, etc.

I hope this is not the norm as I can go down the street next time if I want chicken salad and I know it will be fresh and good.

name: Christie Ray
text: Love the food at Newk’s but am starting to be concerned about the cleanliness. Visited at 3:45 on a Saturday. There were 3 occupied tables hardly anywhere to sit. More than half the empty tables had plates/bowls/trash still left on them. The tables that were clear had trash and such in the seats or were sticky. Several employees were congregated at the front, chatting. The bathrooms are disgusting and need a deep clean.  If they don’t clean the rest of the restaurant, I worry the kitchen is not getting cleaned either.

name: Donald Autery
text: Fruit bowl had a hair in it and the rice krispy treat looked as though it had been bitten. Horrible quality control all around. I will stick with the Newks in Newnan.

name: Steven Bulin
text: It tastes good, don't get me wrong. The menu isn't as diverse as I would like it to be, and there aren't a lot of options. Also, good luck finding a salt shaker.

name: Yonah Carriers
text: Newk Q sandwich is awesome!

name: Stacey Ernstberger
text: Love the food here, but the service needs a bit of work. The cashier was not helpful at all, and got confused at simple questions  - additionally she didn't seem to understand the menu. Her attitude was enough that we almost left. However, the food was great and the server had a very good attitude.

name: Trudy Morgan
text: The cashier tried to be nice but he needed help with the register and called for the manager. She proceeded tell me what I couldn't order, then told me what I could.  I informed her I ordered what was allowed in the first place. I asked for no tomatoes, no mayo and extra mustard. My sandwich had tomatoes and mustard was dripping everywhere. I've received much better food and service in Atlanta.

name: Joseph Rice
text:
I really enjoy the black and bleu salad. Good amount of steak for the price and the salad portion is very fresh.

Today I also got the 6 cheese pimiento mac and cheese as a side. It was 5.99 but it was barely a cup of food. This price is a rip-off for the amount of food. It was delicious but not worth that price.

Additionally I have been to this location twice and each time the person taking the order has been sullen and not welcoming. I think it was the same person both times. A smile and a greeting would be nice customer service.

name: Matthew McArthur
text: Another great Newk's food and dining experience. Would have given 5 stars but most of their employees were all gathered up and on their phones. Literally saw a family have to go find someone to come up and take their order.

name: Robin Ellis
text: They have cauliflower pizza crust, and it's good. Cost more but it's better for you.

name: Jada Mitchell
text: Food is always good. The employee are always respectful ! I will always come back

name: Bruno Ulrich
text: Great clinic. Staff so very accommodating.  And to top things off, Dr. McLean is very thorough and a great lady.  I make the trip from Auburn every six months even though there are dermatologists in town.  And I don't plan to change.

name: Tom Turkington
text: Good sandwiches, soups, and pizzas (more like flat bread). From a fast-food perspective, this is about as good as it gets.

name: Melissa Heigl
text: I love Newk's. Locations are clean, food is always fresh and served quickly. The salads are really generous, but I deleted like the sandwiches are on the smaller side. I love the condiment bar with it's many choices. I can customize my meal and feed my toddler some crackers or breadsticks too!

name: Allan Phillips
text: Nice place. Good food but, a little pricey.

name: sandy simon
text: Good food and quick service.  Wude range of menu options.  Reasonable prices.

name: Chris Surles
text: Awesome food and service!

name: James Persons
text: Had a great experience!! My family went here for a late Sunday lunch. I had an Italian sub with pasta salad. Daughter had kids pizza which was not expensive given that the drink was included. The bbq pizza is also a great pick. The service was also very quick.

name: Bruce Sandlin
text: Shrimp po-boy was good, gumbo was not.

name: Carol Gottlieb
text: Always fresh food. Everything tastes good. Staff friendly.  Clean and lots of room.

name: Janice Roberts
text: I love this place. Food is always top notch. Staff is always friendly. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I also enjoy their tomato basil soup.

name: Chang Park
text: Food has no season on the chicken sandwich

name: Alesia Lyles
text: Good food. Filthy bathrooms. Worker sat in stall over 15 minutes when only one toilet was working. When she came out, she had left a mess. Men’s bathroom was in no better shape. The least you could do is keep the bathrooms clean. Mad3 my experience there bad. Wondered if worker actually went back to prepare food after leaving the mess in the one working stall.

name: Wilson Staubitz
text:
The food preparation needs some classes on how the cross contamination works
Rarely change gloves while working on different orders, touching stored items and then adjusting garments and hair then preparing individual items of food ie: avocado then back to digging into stored item containers
I could go on
Should've made a video but waited to receive my order.

name: Bonnie Edwards
text: Loved the food, the staff was friendly and I will be back!

name: sean ramey
text: Really well put together comfort food, sort of pricey but definitely tasty

name: Greg Jones
text: Seriously this place is amazing. The app is easy to use and the food is fantastic. I order my lunch on the app walk to my car and drive maybe 3 blocks park walk in and the food is ready. Keep it up!

name: Paul Joseph
text: Not a bad place to get a good sandwich over lunch time. Here's a little tip if you get there during a crowded time, Waltz on over to the take-out line and place your order there, and just tell them that you are dining in. I have saved myself many hours it seems over the past few years by doing that little trick. May I suggest the Royal Sandwich with banana peppers. That is my favorite. Overall I find the food very good but for the cost of a sandwich and drink it is a little pricey for this area. If you just looking for a sandwich and a drink you can go to Jersey Mike's or Subway or Which Wich and get a good sandwich, chips and drink for more reasonable price, but don't short Change yourself you have got to try this place

name: Dave Hagman
text:
Casual order at the register and seat yourself restaurant.
Pro tip:
View and decide what to order before hand to avoid feeling pressure to order.
I would certainly go back.

name: Lisa Roberson

name: Wendy Parrish
text: We both had the pick two- sandwich and soup - and it was so good. The warm soup hit the spot on this chilly day, and the sandwich was a tasty filler.

name: David Moon
text: Excellent food and employees. Very courteous staff.

name: Andrea Clark
text: Food and service were excellent.

name: T Potts
text: A little slow on service but Mac and Cheese was very good. Veteran discount given

name: Carolyn Gibson
text:
While traveling from GA through Alabama. I’ve eaten several times at Newks in Tiger Town shopping center in Opelika.
Today I stopped for lunch & was very disappointed. I ordered a shrimp & avocado salad. I love both of these foods, but today my salad was topped with avocado & every piece was brown. Very unappetizing.  I was so disappointed & had to pick off every piece of avocado. I like green fresh looking avocado.  And food there is not cheap.
May not be stopping by anymore.

name: William Hodge
text: Clean,courteous, professional experience. A healthy and tasty alternative when you decide to dine out.

name: Rosa Holloway
text: Love the food and the family atmosphere. Great place to eat.

text: Fantastic... excellent food... very quick service... BRAVO!

text: Long line at 13:00. Food served fast. Chef salad was fresh and good. Daughtet in law had the chicken salad sandwich and said it was delish.

name: Rob Burks

name: C M
text: This used to be my favorite place to eat. Within the last few years the location has slowly went down hill. You can tell management is slacking & the employees are just not happy. The establishment is nasty - for example: the round table is nasty, the plastic containers to put condiments in are missing, the drink station has what appears to be mold growing around the tea dispenser, & the booths haven’t had a good cleaning in forever. I’m done going here until the management gets better & someone is hired to actually clean.

resp.text: Thank you Joshua ! We are so glad you had an awesome visit, hope to see you again soon!

name: mike green
text: Food was decent. Staff was setting in a corner talking. The two staff members working in the kitchen went to their phone often. Then I witness one wipe his nose in a tissue, throw the tissue away and then pick up a plate and deliver to another customer. I stopped eating right then! Dont think I will be back.

name: Victor Cuevas

resp.text: Thank you Victor ! We are so glad you had an awesome visit, hope to see you again soon!

name: Brandon Boyd
text: I was served a hair in my caviar. Had to ask for the manager. She wasn't proactive. Other than that the food was good. No avocado 🥑 in my wife's salad.

name: Carolyn Jorgensen
text: Veggie pizza, I hope it will be made the same every time I go.

name: Christopher McLeroy

name: Shirez

name: Daniel Stoneback

name: Jody Noles

name: keita stephens
text: Love the salads and pizza one of my favorites lunch spots

name: Mark S.

name: Randal Roberts
text:
Newk's is super good food. It's a bit heavy, so come hungry.

I strongly suggest the Debra or Newk's Q.

resp.text: Hi Randal ! Thank you very much for your wonderful review! We work really hard to offer the best food in a welcoming environment. Hope to see you again soon !

name: Susan Culberson
text: Very good food, a lil pricy.

name: Sammy Patrick

name: Nicole Laliberte
text: I LOVE the Mediterranean pizza here💖💖

name: Rhett King
text: The Newk’s Q pizza and the Ultimate salad are where it’s at! Good BOGO deals often too.

name: Dakota Gregg
text: Great food, great staff

name: Paul Howell
text: Always great food no matter what you get.  I recommend the spicy shrimp pizza though.

name: Samantha York
text: Here for lunch. Staff extremely friendly.  Great shrimp po boy sandwich

name: david kimsey
text: Always a good bite.. the new Thai chicken soup is great

name: Kevin Espey
text: Fied shrimp poboy had not fried shrimp... Roast beef poboy was not great.. roast beef was tough .

name: Deborah Camp

My favorite sandwich is their Ahi Tuna, but it is only available during certain times of the year.

text:
MY GRANDCHILDRENS AND I, LOVE MCDONALD'S........
BIG MAC FOR ME

name: David Fendley
text:
I never leave reviews but I’ll never be back to this McDonald’s again. I’m the 5th car in line and after 18 minutes I’m now the 3rd car in line and I’m pulling out of it so I won’t be late for work. It’s never may I take your order at the speaker and I tell them I’ve got a mobile order and they don’t want the code they still say second window.
Find a manager that can work a headset or teach someone else to take an order at the speaker because this is every morning I have been! When you do contact me directly so I can try this location again.

name: Harvey Mellard
text: Quick and easy breakfast on the go. Food has been good every time I've visited. They have yet to mess up and order on me, but then again, I ordered basic stuff without any customizations.

name: Terrica Campbell
text: The Manager Ms Lakesha Johnson (not sure how to spell her name but) anyways she was very much rude & the new girl who was on the front had just started yesterday mistakenly rung me for no caramel with my large frappe but explained to me Kesha that I’ve wanted extra caramel long story short it’s not the girls fault ms lakesha charged me .55 for extra caramel that’s usually free at other locations (not upset about the money) but I want what I paid for .. she only gave me caramel drizzle on the top instead of just remaking the whole frappe

name: Gary Weaver
text: Stated dining room was open until 11, doors locked. Didn't have anything about COVID posted for dining room to be locked. Wanted to use the restroom and get coffee on return trip from Houston and still had 2.5 hours to drive. Wife was not feeling good and wanted a drink. Said drive thru was open, nothing in that line was moving and no one answered on the menu speaker to take an order.

name: Dr. J Epickock
text: This place was alright. They had clean bathrooms. And decent burgers. The shake machine was broken.. Weak...

name: Rick Howell
text: Its Mcdonalds.  I count it a win if I get close to what I order and I don't get shot in the drive through  line.

name: Mary-Lynne Scott
text: Arrived in town a little early for an event so we thought we would pop on in to McDonald's drive thru for a quick bite.  Longest wait ever and 3 out of the 6 meals we ordered were incorrect.   Is that half bad or half good??  At least the food was hot. . .

name: Lauren Rogers
text: Coffee was a great, drive thru was fast & Friendly.

name: Carla Young
text: Food was good! It would be nice if the cashier would be trained how to  add a coupon to an order when the scanning system is down instead of  saying we can't use it. The manager came over and did it with no problem.

name: Candace Gordon
text: Poor service. They need to close this store down. Nasty store. Nobody ever answers the phone. They know they mess up and thats why they don't answer the phone. Poor management.

If they get overwhelmed, they should maybe be allowed to take a few minutes to collect themselves. Everyone deserves an opportunity to get themselves together when working with the public. It's not that easy.

text: Very nice facility and top notch Customer service.

text: I work overnights during the hurricane. I went through the drive through and accidentally left my card. (I was sleepy and wasn't thinking straight) The manager kept my card and I was able to get it back. She would not let me reward her for it. Thank you ma'am!!!!

name: Don Wiley
text: Like I said before it's one of my favorite place to go and eat

name: That One No one
text: Can I get o stars. 10 min waiting on the front counter and not even a 👋 HI. 2pm and no one in line. Good luck guys. Not for me. 👎 👎 👎

name: Faith Williams
text: Moist hot tasty

name: Stephen Knight
text: Horrible. I'm amazed they are still in business. I waited in the drive through line 20 minutes before they took my order and the cashier had the worst attitude. To top it off my order was completely wrong. Burger King will have my business from now on. They may be slow but at least they are polite.

name: Pam c
text: Took forever before she acknowledged me at the receiving window. Order was wrong and employee had an issue when I said I didn't mind paying for it to be correct. Then I didn't get ALL of my drinks. More attitude. Asked to see the manager (I could see her in a red shirt) and she sent a different employee. Then the oatmeal was dry and inedible. HORRIBLE!

name: Cody Owens
text: This mcdonalds has some of the worst service I have ever seen. They are supposed to open at 5 am but there has been at least more than 15 times that I know of where they will let you sit at the drive thru and not answer you. I have even sat there with other people for 10 minutes or more waiting on someone to answer the intercom to no avail.  Always some yelling and cussing going on in the back too. 100% horrible service all the way around

name: Lee Will
text: McDonald's seem to want to serve cold fries every time I go there I have to give them back to them who wants to eat cold french fries 🤔

name: Paul Reed
text: Quick, food. Just chicken nuggets

name: Jerrelle Bryant
text: Been here twice.  Each time I've sat in the drive through for more then 30 minutes. When you pull up to make your order it takes them five minutes to ask you for it, ridiculous.

name: Paul Onderdonk
text: Guess I'm never stopping here again. Food quality is usually low to started with (even for a McDonald's). Went inside and stood at the counter for 5mins, everyone saw me but never acknowledged me or took my order so I walked out and went next door to Wendy's.

name: Orlando England
text: Well, I've stopped by many McDonald's over the span of my life but, the staff at this particular one was very PROFESSIONAL and POLITE. Ms. Kelsey and her manager went out of their way to accommodate my special order request and I TRULY do thank them BOTH for being soo very kind!! Indeed, you DON'T see this much in fast food services nowadays!👏👏👏🙏👌👍👍❤💯

name: Dan S
text: Slow slow drive threw. Waited 15 minutes and never moved. Went somewhere else.

name: Miss Macy
text: This has not been the first time I have gone to this particular McDonald's.  It appears the entire crew is never on same page (get customer in and out in timely manner), but instead argue loudly among themselves with a lobby full of paying customers listening and looking while asking the question...can I just have my food please. It was 15 minutes before I was able to place my order. To be fair, maybe the food wasn't ready quick enough or maybe ran out. However,  some plan to keep enough (or more than enough food) in the bin should be implemented! On a positive note, my food was hot, flavorful and delicious!

name: Timothy Wakefield
text: Strict social distancing guidelines are in place here

name: Melissa Dunn

name: Po Peyton

name: Joni Hawkins

SO freaking SLOW!!! Be prepared to wait a long time for your food.

If you decide to wait it out, make sure to check your order for accuracy!!

name: Alan Moorer

name: Eugenia Bernard

name: matthew c
text:
I haven't eaten at McDonald's in quite some time. They have a daily special at this one and today's daily special was a fried chicken sandwich with fries and a drink for $5. the chicken was hot and tasty the vegetables inside refresh the bun was nice and soft.  The fries were good as usual, and fresh.
One more thing the ladies working the drive thru windows were very nice and courteous.

name: Will Shotack
text: Overall bad McDonalds staff sucks

name: Andre Davis
text: It was very NASTY, and the food was cold plus slow Service!!!!

name: blake vonheeder
text: Every time I go here they have the absolute worse attitude. It’s unfortunate as it’s the only location close to my work site. Today I asked for a McFlurry should’ve known better since it’s ALWAYS not working but the individual replying back “you already know it’s not working” is the most unprofessional and obviously shows lack of leadership as the old saying goes attitude reflects leadership.

name: Krystal Littrell
text: Slow as can be!! Took 20 minutes in the drive thru for a medium fries and small McFlurry. People we actually honking their horns because it was taking so long. Worst Place ever! Do yourself a favor and eat elsewhere.

name: Tameka Mustafa
text: Fast and friendly

name: clay barner
text: All messed up

name: Adrianne Ward
text:
UNHAPPY MEAL! ☹️Happy Meal didn’t include toy, and no mustard, or pickle and just the smallest amount of onion and ketchup!
Would recommend everyone to either pass this place, or check everything well before driving away!

name: veronica vasquez
text: The worst service

name: Leah Stephens
text: The girl upfront was a delight. I wish I knew her name as to give her the credit she deserves. She was waiting on mgmt to get her change but she did all she could until that happened. Crazy as it may be the management was not as good as the crew. I went at breakfast time and I got a steak bagel. This sandwich is risky to get because if it is not fresh it's awful, however to date, this is the best breakfast steak bagel McDonalds.

name: Amy Ellison
text: I saw a review that said they had table service that must fluctuate with the staff because that was not true today.  The coffee machine was broken so no McCafe.  They yelled my order twice while I only had to walk halfway to the counter where I still had to wait for them to bag food. Why not just bag it then call me up? The staff was rude.  And the eating environment is nothing but hearing them yell out orders to one another and the grinding of what I am assuming is the Mcflurry machine?!? No festive Christmas music to drown out the choas . NO holiday pies...is this really even McDonalds?

name: Ultreya Park
text: Hashbrown was made on the spot and delicious. Apple pie is way better than it used to be! Salad has romaine and bit of spinach w tomato w Newman's Own dressing (only one slice of carrot though), very fresh n crisp. Would be a great pick up to add more toppings to at home when short on time. Ordering kiosks were broken though w/no explanation, and it caused backup bc had to order at window, but the woman did apologize for the inconvenience. There wasn't much else open past 10 p.m. and discovered they have that decent side salad @$1.89, a hashbrown for $1 and an apple pie for $1+, all vegan. So that was good.

name: Nicole McCall
text: This place is trash! And the service was the worst! The employees have attitudes, they were arguing and bickering among themselves,  and it was just a nightmare. Plus, they took forever with everyone's food. It literally took 20 minutes to order our food then another 15 minutes to recieve our food. That doesn't make any sense! Never coming back! And the receipt says rate us highly satisfied, HA, ABSOLUTELY NOT!!!!!!!!

name: Zac Stephens
text: This is the SLOWEST fast food restaurant in the world! McDonald's is usually fast but this one is like waiting for them to catch the cow and process it and then cook it.

name: Angela Sanctified
text: Love the Carmel Frappuccino

name: Chris Young
text: Quick drive thru on Saturday

name: Larry Yuknis
text: Another fast food place in Mobile that never has their shake machines working.

name: John Williams
text: It's McDonald's for christ's sake.

name: Mel G
text: Love this location!! The food is always piping hot. Sometimes the wait at lunch time is a little slow. I work in the area and often visit for a quick lunch. Great manager!! Good food!! Hot fries!!

name: Luis Villalba
text: Bad service.

name: Kelly T.
text: The food was really good and fresh. The cashier was pleasant too. Only con I had with this visit, was when I walked in, there was a lady manager who was talking loud and rudely to a couple of her workers. I didn't feel that to be appropriate or professional, especially where the customers could hear. I felt bad for the two workers the manager was speaking to. :(

name: Bill Roberts
text: It's mcdonalds, fresh food, fast service, good deals. They will give you unsalted fries if you wait.

name: Kalcam10 Willis
text: Slow, order not made correctly,  charged for another order, wrong drink.

name: Mike Shugart
text: 4-17-2019: The crew, especially Debra and Dedra,  were friendly and welcoming. The lobby was immaculate and the food good. As a visitor to Mobile, This place is a welcomed  'port in the storm.'

name: Lee Gilchrist
text: Fast service

name: Sheila Queen
text: They were busy but fast

name: Beatriz Jimenez
text: A quick stop but was not disappointed. The food is great. I went through the drive through, and even though the line was kind of long, it went by quickly. Thank you!

name: Alyah McGriff
text: I’ve ordered from here a couple of times on Uber Eats and they disappointed me both times. They take way too long to prepare an order for it to not be fresh.

name: Furqan Khan
text: Bought Mocha Frape, it was full of ice..... SMH

name: Devious Destiny
text: Amazing..LoVinG it

name: yolanda morrissette
text: Very fast service

name: Wanda Berryhill
text: They always fix the wrong food item even when you go inside they still don't fix your order right. They never ever ever have ice cream. They're offering a ice cream dish with no ice cream.

name: latoya penningsworth
text: Nice service. Not a big McDonald's fan but went in to eat with some family. They have table service so no need to stand around waiting for the order. Staff was especially nice to the kid in our group.

name: Jaylyn Hogan-Duncan
text: Terrible service. Every time we come, it always takes too long for orders to come out. Even if there isn't that many customers there, the line takes forever. The inside looks very nice but it always seems like there isn't enough staff members. I would not recommend coming to this location considering I will never come back.

name: louis jackson
text: Good service but can be a little better

name: Janean Harris
text: In terms of timing and accuracy this McDonald's is typical. However, I haven't had one bad experience in terms of service. It's definitely one of the more friendly and clean locations in town.

name: Check Out Southeast
text: Not a good experience.  Waiting in line about five minutes only to be told the ice cream machine wasn't ready...at 1pm in the afternoon? Really? This is why Wendy's got a great review.

name: Autumn Bevels
text: This place is crazy, they make you pull up after you order your food then they only bring you half your food, once you tell the worker that you are missing more food they roll their eyes at you like you are crazy. And then only bring half your food. NOPE NEVER GOING HERE AGAIN. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!

name: Cynthia Adams
text: Excellent customer service

name: Jessica
text: Tasty 😋

name: Taylor Smith
text: I ordered a large iced coffee got to the window they handed me a small. I told them it was supposed to be a large so “rudely” she takes it back  pours it into a medium cup and hands it back!?

name: Braylen Mcmillian
text: Wonderful

name: Shaka tv
text: I don't eat it but the grandkids do . The place was clean and the staff were friendly enough.

name: Jay Rabb
text: Not crowded. Ordered 2 cups of coffee. Had to wait 10 minutes. Another customer got theirs before us. Had to ask for it to get it! Been par for the course for years. Good service at Mc D's is rare.

name: miranda moore
text: Pulled up, ordered promptly. 4 cars ahead of me...waited 14 minutes for 2 Large drinks, no food just drinks. Horrible service!!

name: Vernon Williams
text: Typical McD but slow service

name: Shonda Thomas
text: Very fast and courteous service

name: Lewis Watts

name: Jordan Dennis
text: Takes forever, but they are the only McDonalds I've gone to that has given me the correct order.

name: Tiffany D
